Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Francesco visit to see friends and enjoy Rome”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were pleasant and helpful when asked for assistance - especially with ordering us taxis. However, no one was available to take us to our room or help with the luggage on arrival/departure. The breakfast was disappointing as it was mainly vivdly coloured cakes and biscuits and the bread and fruit options were limited. Cappuchino coffee had to be requested from the bar and was not automatically offered - suprising for Italy. Our room was dark and we had constant problems with the lights - which had to keep being fixed by staff - when available. The room overlooked a building site and the noise was dreadful from early morining to late afternoon - this was not mentioned prior to our booking. Our bathroom was light and airy and was the best feature of the room - the shower was very good. It was cleaned every day to a good standard Overall - I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to stay near Trastevere but only once the building works were finished and with the above suggestions for improvement taken into consideration..

Reviews.Title: “Still good”
Reviews.Author: rosecat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the San Francesco before and love its location in Trastavere.The decor is tastefully arty and if you get a room at the back your view is over the gardens of the old monastery.There are marble floors and a feeling of airyness. The bathrooms are spacious, the bedrooms a reasonable size and beds comfortable.There are bells that ring quite early but you are in Italy after all . Breakfast is good although the tables are only for two which means possibly not sitting together if you are a group of four. It is not far to the river and most of the big sites like the Forum and the Vatican are within walking distance if you are reasonably fit.We never used the trams but the No 8 is the one to look for I believe.Trastevere is so much more peaceful than the centre of Rome and there are many little restaurants and bars in the area of the hotel . It is a bit of a nuisance getting a taxi from Termini station when you arrive on the airport bus especially if you do what we did, knowing full well not to , and took a taxi which was unlicenced because the others were having a lightening strike. We got ripped off of course with the old trick of being told we had given a five euro note and not twenty. We stood our ground and they took off at great speed when we said we would get the hotel manager. The San Francesco is not as cheap as when we first discovered it but is still good value.Note that there is a 2 euro a day per person tax that has to be paid in cash at check out.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: Ithakate
Reviews.Content: It was a real pleasure to stay 2 nights in this hotel. It was comfortable, the service was great, the location was ideal (just a short distance away from the heart of Trastevere, and probably quieter as a result). The room was lovely, the bathroom was huge, lots of light, good bed, good reading lights. The breakfast was served in a sunny, pleasant room, and was excellent. I felt pampered. One warning: a nearby church rings bells at 7 and 7:15 a.m. every morning - if you plan to get up then, you don't need a wake up call. If not, you might want to try earplugs. And another note: on Via San Francesco, as you head into the middle of Trastevere, on your left (right as you enter the street) is the Ripa Caffe Bar. In the back, they serve really excellent espresso - the best we had in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in March and had a great time albeit most of the time we were out and about. The location is excellent being very close to the tram and bus stations. The centre of trastevere is only 5 minutes away and the centre of Rome is within walking distance but we found it easier to get the tram in. The hotel rooms are probably in need of some modernisation but you could hardly fault the place for the price we paid (average of £62 per night Mon-thurs including breakfast). The staff are very friendly, wifi is free although you do have to get a different code every 24 hours and the breakfast was absolutely fine, albeit the coffee was not up to scratch when compared to the coffee you can get in Rome. Great location and would stay here again as we loved the location being so close to the trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than an ordinary 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alfred03081952
Reviews.Content: We spend a 4 days in San Francesco Hotel in Trastevere and we were very pleased. The hotel have a very good position, close to the tram station on Viale de Trastevere and 15-20 min. by foot from all the famous attractions of Rome. The loby is spacious , nice furnitured and the reception staff very friendly and helpful. A very pleasant and quiet music is played. The room was not very big but functional. The bathroom was big and well equipped. The breakfast room is very nice and the quality of food very good. Certainly , San Francesco Hotel in Trastevere is a hotel to be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: travelbeanies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Francesco for four nights in February 2012 and had a brilliant holiday in Rome. The location is perfect - in the heart of Trastevere with its cobbled streets and an array of eateries and plazas. There are excellent public transport links to other areas of Rome but we decided to walk most of the time as major tourist attractions such as the Vatican and the Colosseum were only a 20-30 minute walk away. The rooms were very clean with extremely comfortable beds. The bathroom was a decent size and although the room itself wasn't that big, it was adequate for two people. Breakfast was great with an excellent choice of breads, meats, cheeses, pastries, cakes and cereal every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noticable decline since Dec' 2010”
Reviews.Author: Chumbeiro
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed in this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary in Dec 2010 and were suitably impressed. Returning to stay with family in three rooms in Dec 2011 was sadly disappointing. The location is great - 42 Euro in a taxi from the airport or 8 Euro by train to the Trastevere station followed by a 20 minute /walk - you choose! Trastevere has a great mix of shops, bars and restaurants; some more gentrified/tourist-orientated than others. Walking to most of main sites or the Historic Centre is possible in approx' 30 minutes. Our family group had three rooms over two floors. All rooms are on the small side but clean. The decor in all three rooms was decidedly shabby with peeling wallpaper around the windows. Peeling paint on the staircase was definitely not 'artfully applied'! Urgent need of a re-furb. Breakfast was adequate with a mix of meat/cereal/ fruit etc. Desk and waiting staff were friendly, and spoke better English than my Italian! On the penultimate night of the stay there was no hot water available. This had not been remedied by the next morning. Whilst I don't mind a 'fresh' shower my 70 year-old mother definitely didn't appreciate a cold wash! We did get an discount on the room rate but guests in hotel should not be expect to go without such a basic for 36 hours. In conclusion - if you search for the best rates and want a clean hotel in a good location and don't expect luxuries then Hotel San Francesco is a decent choice, it just needs a bit of TLC to make it a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor facilities.”
Reviews.Author: audrey-g-l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful part of Rome - Trastevere is a lovely area with a lot of nice restaurants and bars and seems fairly safe. It's within walking distance of the Colosseum. But I cannot recommend this hotel. I was expecting great things from other reviews I'd seen and pictures online, and even the foyer gives a grand entrance, but the twin-bed room we stayed in was dark and dank, the furniture was old and outdated, the beds incredibly hard, and the bathroom was unventilated (what is it with hotels having no fans in bathrooms?!) and had black mold on the walls. The shower cubicle was absolutely tiny. The roof-top bar looked fabulous online and in person and while its door was open, there were never any staff there. It was late autumn, but these were nice, fine days, and a drink outdoors overlooking part of Rome would have been lovely. I'd recommend saving more than half and staying at one of Rome's monasteries instead of here - the room felt like staying in a convent anyway.

Reviews.Title: “San Francesco is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: FSHphd
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francesco is a great find in the Trastevere in Rome. It is well-priced and very clean. Lovely restaurants are in a very short stroll as well as shops with regional food and wine. The staff is helpful and accommodating. I would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I tried hard to like this hotel.... But....”
Reviews.Author: Zachary_F_N
Reviews.Content: First, the pros: -It is close to (but not in) the cool part of Trastavere (about 5 min walk ... And I loved Trastavere... Took family to Mass, parishioners were very friendly even though we were tourists) -It is accessible to several different bus routes making access to the center very easy. -Rome! -Breakfast wasnt bad, although after three days I was pretty sick of the monotony. - beautiful garden in breakfast room, with ficus, china dolls and bananas. Cons: -Dirty carpets (total deal breaker... Personal pet peeve) -Very "hit-or-miss" customer service (example, front desk told us no ice for our room, but immediately after shift change @ 10 pm, ice suddenly became available from the new night staff) - worst "free" Internet: we had three devices (iPad, iPhone and Blackberry) and for each device every 24 hours we had to go to the front desk to get a new password and then, we lost connection every 20 minutes and had to re-connect with user name and password... Over and over again every day. - poor air ventilation, extremely dusty, smelly room, with visible dust on our stuff after on night.... I eveloped cough, sore throat and sneezing after first night that went away as soon as I checked out -ridiculous price for value (about a us$50 room for about 3 times the price ... No tissue paper, 4 channels on tv, two towels per room, broken furniture in room) - minibar was silly... A mostly empty fridge with two (literally) items (chips, beer) no water, for example) that never got replaced in 3 days (i suppose i could have gone down to the front desk at 2 am for water, but for the price i paid i shouldnt have to....) Normally i have two standards: i prefer my rooms to be clean, even if simple, and i prefer to pay fair price for value received. Maybe other guests had very lower expectations but for me i was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: RobR947
Reviews.Content: Pros -Beautiful room with good style -Very comfortable bed -Helpful staff -Pretty good location in a fun part of Rome - about a 5-7 minute walk from the "heart" of Trastevere; highly recommended for people who have been to Rome before and looking for a location away from the standard tourist attractions Cons -Sketchy elevator -Spotty internet connection, needed to go down to lobby most of the time to get a good signal

Reviews.Title: “*** + in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: happyfoodie098
Reviews.Content: The location is one of the very best things about this hotel + excellent front desk staff. They were very good on local knowledge and advice about how to get where, and what to see. Easy to walk to a large number of the city's most popular sights (Vatican, Coleseum, Forum). A delightful part of the city, loads of good restaurants and endless medieval lanes to wander round safely and unmolested by 'hawkers'. The room was a reasonable size, we had a spacious and spotlessly clean bathroom and loads of really hot water. Good and plentiful breakfast served by friendly and helpful staff. Only fly in the ointment was quite a lot of traffic noise at night. However, good value and excellent location more than made up for this and for a shortish stay (3 nights in our case) pretty ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Average +”
Reviews.Author: Ryegate
Reviews.Content: Rome is a city where you get what you pay for when it comes to hotels. That may sound self evident but is particularly true in Rome. The price for the San Francesco is reasonable and the hotels amenities are reasonable. The front desk service staff are above average which might lead one to choose this hotel over the many other reasonably priced Rome hotels. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are equally small. If you are on an extended trip with lots of luggage, it will be a challenge to store the bags. The rooms are clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel has a roof top area where you can enjoy a drink and watch the sun set on the city. It is fairly basic but is served by a bar tender and the perspective of the city is quite different.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Denise G
Reviews.Content: After spending wonderful 10 nights at the charming Hotel San Francesco it was difficult to leave. The accommodations were very comfortable, large lovely tile baths, very nice breakfast, the staff was always courteous, friendly, very helpful and even provided some excellent local restaurant recommendations. We loved the quaint neighborhood location in residential Trastevere. We discovered a neaby wine shop, a 4th generation deli & a wonderul chocolate shop just a short walk from the hotel. What more do you need? After site seeing throughout busy central Rome it was a delight to retreat back to this charming hotel in the afternoon and enjoy a glass of wine and the stunning city view from the outstanding roof top terrance. Just simply an ideal hotel and would highly recommend it as an excellent place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views of the Eternal City!”
Reviews.Author: jojowego
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here at the Hotel San Francesco before taking the train across Italia from Roma to Venezia for another week. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, I think it was one of the nicest AFFORDABLE hotels I have ever stayed at. As an Italian-American who had never before visited "the Old Country" I was VERY impressed by the old-world style and unique charm of this boutique hotel located in the mostly residential neighborhood of Trastevere across the Tiber River. It's a great, relatively peaceful and quiet part of the Eternal City that still has great restaurants and is not too far removed from the great tourist spots like the Spanish Steppes and the Colloseo. My room in this hotel was fantastic!! Not too big (by American standards) but very clean and comfortable with great tall windows overlooking the courtyard of an ancient monastery where I could hear the bells toll every day. The bathroom was painted the most beautiful shade of blue and it had an awesome black tile shower, a towel heater rack on the wall, and even a bidet (very European!) The stairways are made of glorious white Italian marble and they lead up to the most fabulous rooftop smoking deck that offered spectacular panoramic views of all of Roma!! They have a large banquet room off the lobby where they served delicious sweet Italian pastries and cookies every morning. And the older man who was working the front desk was one of the very few people I met in Italy who spoke English and was therefore able to assist me with directions. Staying at the Hotel San Francesco was definitely a highlight of my first trip home to the land of my ancestors, and I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: 1jammicrackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our first 3 nights in Italy and I didn't want to leave! Friendly and helpful staff, clean and glistening bathroom, clean, comfortable and fully equipped bedroom, a delightful continental breakfast and a picturesque rooftop bar where we recuperated after a hard day's sightseeing before heading out to the local restaurants and bars. Even the other guests were lovely! The hotel is a little way out, but it's very easy to get into the centre, with trams and buses running constantly. As two young women we felt very safe in this area (compared to some other areas in Rome - don't go near the streets by the termini!) in fact Trastevere is a great area to be in and I will most certainly be returning to Hotel San Francesco on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base in Trastavere area”
Reviews.Author: Lotty24
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in Trastavere area of Rome. Close to lots of cool bars and nice restaurants. Easy to travel to the main sights by bus or taxis as we found they weren’t too expensive. We weren’t too far from the Coliseum. The reception area is very nice and staff friendly enough. Our room was very small and very dark, the lamp wasn’t working which didn’t help. The guy on reception came to try and fix it but wasn’t able to, he was friendly though and helped us order pizza from a nearby takeaway when we arrived late at night. Bathroom was fairly spacious and clean. Big windows looked out over a pretty garden which looked like it belonged to a convent. A continental breakfast buffet was included in the price and the cakes were especially tasty! It was my friend’s birthday during our trip and I emailed the hotel to let them know prior to arrival, they emailed back to say they would arrange a bottle of Prosecco which was a nice touch. All in all the hotel was perfectly adequate for our stay and if you want a good value hotel in the Trastavere area I would recommend staying here but perhaps ask if they have a spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelhound51
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 8 adults travelling around Italy for 2 weeks, and we spent our last 5 nights at this wonderful boutique hotel. We wanted to stay in Trastevere, across the Tiber River, so that we could be out of the "Rome madness". We're so very glad we did. The hotel is a 10 Euro cab ride (about 5 min) from the Trastevere train station. The staff were all so nice and helpful. It's a small hotel (24 rooms), and it's just perfect. The rooms are small, but very cozy and very clean. They do have A/C, but in the summer heat, they weren't overly powerful. That being said, we just weren't in the rooms much at all, and when we were, we were exhausted and didn't really care. My favourite parts of this hotel are the location and the rooftop patio. After a crazy day in Rome, it was just magic to cross the river in the vibrant neighbourhood of Trastevere. The hotel is just blocks from three very cute piazzas where there are wonderful little cafes. And the rooftop patio! It's 5 stories up, and so wonderful! It was fabulous to wind down with the family after a crazy day of touring around and enjoy some Italian wine before an 8:00 or 9:00 dinner. And the breakfast was just perfect to start each day. There are danishes, cereal, meats, cheeses, yogurt, juices, and coffee. Just right! I highly recommend this hotel and Trastevere, and we will definitely be back to both.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jasmineflowerface
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in this hotel in February 2010, but the review date options did not go back that far. Sorry for the lateness of the review. Six of us went to Rome for the Scotland /Italy rugby match and we chose this hotel based on the reviews and the price. It is a little out of the centre of Rome, only 5 minutes on the tram, but that only made it a better location for us. The area is cobbled streets, great restaurants, reasonably priced and not too touristy. The hotel was clean and friendly. The bedrooms are not roomy, but the shower room was great, considering we were 6 women - this was a priority. Breakfast was continental and was fine with a good choice and plenty of coffee. The roof terrace bar is not open in February, but the door was unlocked, so we had our own little pre-dinner drinks session up there when one of our party had a birthday. If I was going back to Rome - which I will one day - I would definately stay in the Trastevere area again, and probably in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: shaznay76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. It ruined our last night in Rome. The woman on reception was very unhelpful after we complained that the air conditioning didn't work although she assured us it did and we ended up having to sleep with wet towels on our head. We couldn't open the window as it was very noisy outside and our view was of a building site. Rooms were small and overall it was a depressing experience. Very expensive for what it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet corner of Rome”
Reviews.Author: lowfields
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel, despite the small size of the room... It was very clean, with a modern, generous bathroom, nice decor and a very appealing breakfast room overlooking a private garden. The service was friendly but unobtrusive, and the location was convenient for trams into central Rome or a 5-minute stroll to the cobbled streets of Trastevere, where restaurants spill out onto every piazza. Well priced, it is the ideal place for weekend breaks. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good value good location”
Reviews.Author: linkSuffolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in the middle of the more bohemian side of Rome. The staff are very friendly and readily changed my mothers room to a higher floor as the first was a bit small with no window in the bathroom. The rooms in general are fine, the fittings are slightly worn but the bathrooms are lovely. Breakfast is a bit samey but the choice is good. We were disappointed that the roof terrace was not open but in the end we woudn't have had time to sit as there really is so much to see. I would certainly recommend this hotel especially for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Alex186370
Reviews.Content: Right next door to the San Francesco church (ask priest to show you the room st Francis of assisi stayed) on the edge of Trastevere close to the Porta Portese. Excellent value we paid about £70 per night for a twin/double with breakfast.(2 euros per person per day payable in cash on top.) Clean rooms with safe , bathroom with shower. Not enormous but perfectly adequate. We chose a 4th floor room with views accross the river( but not of it) to the Avetine. There was a beautiful roof terrace with a very distant view of the Coliseum with a bar, closed in winter ,but must be great in the season(it was operating in late october.) It would have been nice to have it operating year round with some outdoor heaters perhaps. Staff very helpful and efficient . Good english spoken at the front desk. My only real quibble was the breakfast which whilst OK could have nbeen much better with a little more effort. Lots of ckes which I gather is the Italian thing but I didnt notice any Iytalians staying during our visit. No toast machine. Sliced oranges and melon every day. Some ratrher tired lookin sliced emmmental and salami. There was plenty of it but just rather uninspiring. The breakfast waiters were doubling as chamber maids, they laid out breakfast as well. There is a bar but no restaurant and a rather slow lift. Plenty of very good cheap restaurants in the maze of streets around and beyond The Santa Maria in Trastevere church. Try the Augusta, Isola da Sicilia, and Caseta de Trastevere opposite the Augusta. Not haute cuisine but good honest roman fare. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone loking in this price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertVPrague
Reviews.Content: Advantage: location - near to the center, with tram no.8 just 7 minutes quiet street price - 70 euro/room free wi-fi Disadvantage: small room thin walls poor breakfest taxi from the airport 50 euro This is good hotel if you don´t expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room, fine breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Chumbeiro
Reviews.Content: Located in the Trastevere District the hotel is close to the tourist hub but equally has easy access to bars, superb restaurants and deli's used by the locals. Public areas of the hotel are clean, spacious and well furnished. We stayed in room 204 on the third floor. The room itself was small and the bed was not a full-sized double. Furnishings in the room were perfectly adequate and clean. Light sleepers may need ear-plugs as the dividing walls are very thin and the adjacent church bells will give you a 7 am alarm call. Breakfast buffet was fresh and varied. From the airport, frequent local trains will deliver you to Trastavere Station in about 25 minutes for 8 Euros, the hotel is a 25 minutes walk/10 minute tram ride from Travestevere Station. Note: from the airport, the 'Leonardo Express' Tourist train costs double and will deliver you to the other side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL GOOD LOCATION TRASTEVERE IS GOOD!!”
Reviews.Author: sgma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. I beleive the best thing is it's location. Trastevere at night is a great place to be, lots of restaurants, small streets, due to Christmas all the streets were decorated with ligthings. I love this area! However, central Rome is very nice and beautiful during this time of the year. Re the hotel, the rooms are ok, we were on the back side of the hotel, it was usually quiet there, however be aware of the ringing of the church bell at 5-6 am. The church is very close to the hotel. The staff at the hotel were very much friendly. Breakfast was good. We got a very nice deal, we booked the hotel about 4 weeks prior our arrival and the price was 30% lower than booking the hotel very close to the actual vacation. We took a shuttle from the airport to the hotel with 1 more couple that we met in our flight, they went to another hotel, the shuttle costs 40euro, and if you take a private taxi you pay 50euro. It worth it. You save 20 euro on both sides. All in all, the hotel is nice, do not expect too much and you will be very much pleased with the hotel. I beleive I will go back to this hotel if I will be in Rome again. All I can say that Trastevere is beautiful place to be, mainly during the evening. Grazie mille, gg

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: david17London
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very good breakfasts, lovely beds, good showers. It's near a noisy road (around the back) but with the windows closed and the quiet aircon it's not a problem. Close to lots of restaurants and backstreets. Centre of Rome easily accessible. Close to the river.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Chubanopolus
Reviews.Content: Going down for breakfast at the sumptuous and hearty array of choices was such a treat and a great start to a day full of sightseeing. The view to the courtyard adjoining the old Franciscan cloister is quaint and charming. The next best thing is in the evening after going back to the hotel, take a nap and voila, Trastevere is alive at night with so many great places to eat and so many gorgeous old buildings to admire, all within walking distance from the hotel. And most of all for me, it's right next to a Catholic church where I can go for mass every single day within a minute away from the hotel, was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: mad132
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel and great location to visit sites but retreat from tourist mobs. Perfect to wander around Trastevere at night too. Very lovely staff and don't miss the roof top!

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop bar is the best!”
Reviews.Author: BeckiT
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel in Trastevere, small and charming and the staff (Valentina, Guido, Massimo and others) were all so very helpful. A great neighborhood for those who don't mind walking 15+ minutes into the Center (trams are available), and the area is a must for lively night-time activity just 5 minutes away from the quieter streets surrounding the hotel. The rooms are basic but have good amenities and our prepaid rate of 110E was perfect for the less expensive month of August. The bathrooms are nice, A/C sufficient, breakfast tasty and plentiful. The highlight is the rooftop bar, this is a wonderful bonus for having a glass of your favorite beverage and watching the sun set over the surrounding hillsides. Must eat at Ristorante Paris (upscale but fabulous) and Dar Poeta pizzeria (very casual), both within 10-15 minutes walk away in a busy but safe area even late at night. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who want to be in Trastevere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: clvandyke
Reviews.Content: The rooftop bar makes this hotel. Our room was a bit outdated but it didn't bother us. Bathroom was spacious compared to other hotels in Italy we stayed at. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is a hike from the touristy sites but close to restaurants, bars and cafe's. The internet worked on the 1st floor but was spotty at times.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: H-Wilmes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is ideally situated in Trastevere. it is just a very easy and safe five minute walk into the heart of it all. There are both bus and tram connections to the Vatican, the centre of town (Argentina square) and Termini railway station. Room was small but adequate, big bathroom with tub, rooftop bar very nice, although drinks are a bit pricey, good breakfast (fresh fruit, cheese, ham, sweet rolls, cereal, capuccino, I asked for pane integrale, and they went to the shop to get it for me - five minutes later I had my favorite bread!, very adequate and helpfull reception staff. Just round the corner is a supermarket where you can get bottled water, fresh fruit and anything else you might need, very handy. For the price we paid per night - € 90, - for a double room, this is a good deal. Should you consider staying near Trastevere, this is the place to go for!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome with helpful staff + cool rooftop bar!!”
Reviews.Author: Bowerman_Ellis
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel San Francesco especially as the ever resourceful Mauro on reception was there to help us with any question!! Quiet location just 5 min walk into bars + restuarants of the lively Trastevere. At £90 per night this was a good value and comfortable base to explore Rome. Hiring a Vespa from Bici & Baci was also a highlight. Enjoy!! Seamus & Lucy Dorset, UK

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Sojourn”
Reviews.Author: thropplenoggin
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated near the quiet winding cobbled alleys of the Trastevere quarter of the city, with generally impeccable service at reception, and as fine a roof terrace as you'll find in Rome, where Adrian serves up exquisite margaritas and mellifluous music. Rooms are spacious and as immaculate as that conception. The coffee at breakfast is the best thing about it...for me. A huge choice of food, but if you are a puritan who avoids the pre-processed, you'll struggle. A minor detraction from what is a rare find in this city. In sooth, I would say this: Hie thee thither!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: deirdra_10
Reviews.Content: We booked in February for 5 nights in August for 430.00GBP, B&B. We particularly wanted to stay in Trastevere as we had visited it when last in Rome. This hotel is perfect for Trastevere area, and in fact we walked to St Peters, Piazza Navona, Colosseum,Roman Forum etc. The hotel is very clean and the staff we found to be very friendly and helpful. The only negative was the room which appeared quite dark and lacking in sufficient lighting when we arrived , which was in the evening, but when morning came and we opened the wooden shutters, the glorious Italian sun came shining through! Wonderful. Also the bathroom is very good with plenty of room with a great bath and shower. Very useful for soaking your feet while having a shower, after a long day's walking around Rome and it's wonderful sites. Would definitely stay at the San Francesco again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a 2 centre family holiday in Rome & Sorrento. Rooms are small (which I think is common for hotels in this catagory) but bathrooms are very bright, clean and spacious. I would tend to agree that the rooms are a bit box like, this wasn't an issue for us because we were out exploring most of the time. The hotel has a pleasent calm feel to it , staff are welcoming and helpful , a huge plus is the very relaxing roof bar area. Free wireless internet available in the rooms. Hotel location felt very safe in a qiet area a few minutes walk from the centre of Trastevere with good transport links to the major sites (bus & Tram linking to Rail & metro). If you're travelling from the airport be sure to take a white taxi. The white taxi's have a regulated flat fare of 40 Euro from the airport into Rome city centre - ignore the meter and insist on paying only the 40 Euro. There is a so called express train from the airport to the main station but this is slow , hot and costs 14 Euro one way and you still have to get from the Main station to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SisselSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Francesco for 6 nights, really good! Beautiful big bathroom, smaller bedroom, lift, free internet (computer provided) and a fantastic roof terrace, with great views and so peaceful! Location of the hotel is perfect, buses and trams in all directions about 30 seconds walk away, one block away from Porta Portese market, and to get to Metro you have only a 5 minute busride to do. Trastevere, the area where the hotel is, is a charming area of Rome, just across The Tiber, hundreds of little bars, restaurants, trattorias, ice-cream bars, narrow streets and lots of life! Next time we are in Rome, we'll stay at San Francesco!

Reviews.Title: “With so many options in Rome, you can skip this one...”
Reviews.Author: runTESrun
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and I was surprised by how expensive hotels can be so booked this place because from the photos it looked like. I should have looked a street view in Google, because it was a poor location. The place across the stree was all boarded up and the immediate area wasn't strange. Travestere is an okay location in Rome (better at night in the small street), but not great during the day. You have to take a bus to go anywhere. The bathroom in our room was awful and had a ton of mold. The floor in the room had plastic covering (like what you'd see on a patio or backyard). You had to wear socks in the room at all times. Good point-- it was super quiet, but I think it was all German's in the hotel. Staff was just ok -- not too friendly but they did help when we asked specific questions. Internet in room did NOT work as advertised. I asked them several times, and they just kept saying "you can use it in the lobby." If it didn't work....why not just say so?

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Could Be So Nice With a Little More Attention”
Reviews.Author: tommyrey
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel San Francesco but have to agree with some of the previous reviews that there is definitely room for improvement. Just a little more work on their part could result in a charming boutique hotel in an interesting location that actually matches their website. Starting with the pros. The building, which is connected to a centuries old church and convent, was charming, the lobby welcoming and the location in the Trastevere neighborhood was a plus for someone wanting a retreat from central Rome. Lots of restaurants and bars within a few blocks. There is a bus stop a block away and a tram stop two blocks away. The staff was always helpful and the sunny breakfast room and breakfast buffet were amazing and a great way to start the day. No hot breakfast items but a huge selection of meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, yogurt etc, even leftover pizza. We appreciated the free wi-fi access and the computer set up for guest use in the lobby. The rooftop deck was a real treat and provided some beautiful views of the church next door but it would have been nicer if the bar had been staffed. The lobby bar was also never staffed and the grand piano in the lobby was never played. Lost opportunities all. And although I have listed the bedroom below under the cons, the bathrooms were great. Large, sparkling white and black tile, modern fixtures, large window and high ceilings. Since we were on the 4th floor, we appreciated the elevator and though it was slow, it always worked the week we were there. But then there were the cons. The biggest one is the size and décor, or lack of décor, of the rooms. We were there with 2 other couples and so we know that these comments apply to the rooms in general. The bedrooms are tiny, and though they probably can’t do much about that, any sort of decorating would be an improvement. Unlike other reviewers, we did not see any dirt or mold. In fact we were impressed with the cleanliness. But the chocolate brown wallpaper, unusual floor covering, dingy drapes, solitary black and white etching on the wall and badly chipped furniture and woodwork should be replaced. There was no where to sit in the room and no lighting for reading unless you laid in bed. So definitely not for someone who wants to spend time in their room. And no sense you were in Rome and not New Jersey. Luckily for us the weather was lovely for most of our week we were there so between exploring the neighborhood, sitting on the roof or in the lobby, we didn’t spend much time in our room. And when it came time to sleep though, the beds were comfortable, the linens and pillows were always clean and in good condition and the windows and shutters kept out the noise and the light. The other big con was the lack of toiletries. Someone’s priorities were definitely misplaced. Each day we got a new shoe polishing sponge and shower cap but there was no shampoo or conditioner, no lotion, no mouthwash (even though we were in the land of garlic), one tiny bar of soap that was supposed to be used in both the shower and sink, and no Kleenex other than a tiny packet that held 3 postage stamp size squares of tissue per day. And someone needs to spread the word about washcloths to Europeans. They sell them in the stores, so why don’t hotels provide them? The bath towels were large and clean and very suitable. If you have business in the Trastevere neighborhood like we did (attending a graduation for John Cabot University) you’ll find it to be a handy choice and one of the only hotels in that part of the city. The neighborhood felt safe, even though all the lovely old buildings are absolutely covered with graffiti. But if you are coming to Rome for the first time, the location away from the major sites and the lack of an Italian feel to the décor means you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Francesco: Great location, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: commpro
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and its Trastevere neighborhood. Before booking, I did extensive research. I checked out Trip Advisor and Venere reviews of many hotels, and finally chose Hotel San Francesco. As you will read, our experience was mixed. During peak season, San Francesco room prices average out to 209 Euros a night, taxes and breakfast included. Not cheap, but not as pricey as some of the hotels located near Rome's Spanish Steps neighborhood. Still, the property is probably not worth the prices they charge. The good news: San Francesco's location is great. Trastevere is a lively, happening place, and its many narrow streets and alleys boast numerous trattorias and bars. Trastevere feels more "local" than touristy, if that's possible in a city like Rome. The Hotel San Francesco sits on a quiet side street just a few blocks away from the Tiber River. We were on an upper floor of the hotel and had a lovely view of stately, elegant buildings on the opposite river bank. We slept with our window open, enjoying the cool breezes that blew across the river. The beds were good - firm mattresses, clean linens daily, nice pillows. Overall, the sleep quality was pretty good. The hotel served a very decent, buffet-style breakfast. The bad news: San Francesco has a run-down quality not at all in keeping with other hotels charging over $250 per night. Our room was tiny - about 3 meters square - roughly the size of a very large closet or very small guest room. Put another way, it was barely large enough to contain two side-by-side twin beds, a small desk, two small nightstands and TV sitting atop a barely functioning minibar. There was no dresser, and no place to unpack our clothes. There was one folding luggage rack, but we had two suitcases. That meant one of us had to keep our suitcase on the floor. Okay, I know many European hotel rooms are small by American standards, yet for $250 a night, I (frankly) expected more. All the furniture was beat up, scratched and chipped, like the owners had found it in a junk yard or second-hand shop. The TV was flat screen LCD, but it only had 13" view screen. The truth is, I felt VERY disappointed when I got to the room and saw where we would be spending the week. Any hotel operator who thinks that's okay should not be in business. Our room's tiny closet came equipped with a small coat rack, two shelves and a TINY safe, barely big enough to hold two wallets and passports. There were just five hangers in the closet, not nearly enough for two adults staying for almost a week. The floor was covered with strange "woven" plastic tiles, intended (I think) to mimic straw floor mats, but having a really crappy, cheap feel. And they were somewhat dirty. (Shudder) Our bathroom was fairly large and sunny. It had a huge window that opened out over the street. Overall, the bathroom was nice, but there were a few problems. First, the shower's water temperature would fluctuate unpredictably from hot to cold. Several grout lines were disgusting. They desperately needed replacing due to mold and mildew stains. Finally, like the bedroom, there were no shelves or cabinets - no places to put anything. That made the bathroom inconvenient. The front desk staff at the San Francesco was overall quite professional. We were helped several times by a very pleasant young woman. (We nicknamed her "the nice lady.") Most of the others desk attendants were fine, with the exception of one young man, who bordered on lazy and rude. I won't share the nickname we came up with for him. One night we asked him to make a dinner reservation for us. At first, he told us, "We don't do that for our guests." (You’re kidding, right?) Finally, after much prodding, he acquiesced and begrudgingly phoned the restaurant (where they spoke only Italian) to book an 8:30 p.m. dinner appointment for us. The only problem was, when we got to the restaurant, the maitre-d told us that our reservation had been for 8 p.m. and we missed it. After much begging and pleading, the maitre-d relented and allowed us to dine there. We were glad, because it proved to be our most enjoyable dining experience in Rome. No thanks to the surly, lazy desk clerk at the San Francesco. The truth is, it wouldn't take much for the San Francesco to make things much better. They could invest in higher quality furniture. They could put a full-size dresser in the closet, along with a decent size safe. They could rotate the closet coat rack 90 degrees so it goes across the width of the closet, not from front to rear, and put more hangers. They could replace those cheap plastic floor tiles with carpeting covering, and fix the minibar or eliminate it altogether. (I'd rather have drawers to put my clothes than a non-functioning, tiny refrigerator!) They could put a dresser or decent table in the bathroom. Finally, they could train all their staff in excellent customer service. And they SHOULD fire surly desk attendants. In conclusion, we enjoyed our stay and learned to live with the hotel’s shortcomings. Would I recommend this property to other travelers? Well, maybe, but travelers should definitely understand what they are getting for their 209 Euros. Either the hotel should make the fixes I’ve described above or substantially reduce its price – say to 109 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Quintessential Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: PattyPombo
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Roma for my 50th birthday. I so wanted to like this hotel, but our experience was mixed. In retrospect, the biggest issue was the cost of the room... around $260 US / night for a 11 x 11 foot room with no dresser or room to even lay out the suitcases (yeah, yeah he was paying but i still hate to be ripped off). For $100 or $150 a night, this would be fine but for "New York" prices we wanted more. First the positives: great location, very quiet, nice view from our room, comfortable bed, huge bathroom, beautiful (though unstaffed) roof deck, great free breakfast, generally good service with friendly staff that spoke English. Trestevere is a terrific neighborhood with many nice dining options, and is an easy, safe, colorful 20 minute walk to the ancient city . The negatives: aforementioned tiny tiny room, somewhat ratty appointments, no dresser (!) so we had to live out of the suitcase all week, very poor room lighting, "free wireless" that cut out every 5 minutes requiring a "refresh" of the connection, slowest elevator on earth, shower that pointed water in the wrong direction, and one surly desk attendant who insisted we didnt need a reservation at our Ristorante of choice because it was Wednesday. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a price below 120 euros, but for 200 euros a night, you can do better!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jomled
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had reservations for 4 nights at this hotel - largely based on the what we read in Tripadvisor. The hotel was descibed on Travelocity as charming and having a roof top lounge. Any remotely positve review is wrong - the place is a dump. Where do I begin. We had hoped to stay in trendy Tresteverre but this hotel is on the fringes at best - women in heels beware its a 20 min walk to the main part of Tresteverre. Upon arrival we were told the roof top lounge was not opening for another month. We decided to grin and bear it, but the room set us over the edge. We were welcomed by dirt hanging from the ceiling, mildew in the bathroom, peeling wallpaper, water damaged desk and a stained carpet. The wool blankets were so worn that we joked that the monks themselves used them since the building used to be a monestary. The desk which was warped from water damage had a formica chair in front of it. but the bed was so close to the desk you couldn't move the chair without moving the bed. I opened the window to an alley with a view of trash cans. Other than not sleeping in the train station, this hotel has no redeeming qualities for any average middle class person. At that point I called Travelocity to complain about the bait and switch. My wife and I walked out and sought shelter elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Misswoo101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews in TripAdvisor. We arrived on the 1st April for a five day stay . We arrived very stressed due to a member of our family taking very ill at the airport. On arrival we explained to the hotel manager our circumstance that our father and mother in law would not be arriving due to a sudden illness at the airport which hospitalised my father in law and meant they would not be able to make the journey. The hotel was very understanding and did not charge for the room. The weather was excellent when we were there and we hoped that the roof top bar would have been opened seeing it was the start of the good weather and it was a very busy Easter holiday weekend. Unfortunately it was not open and it would have been ideal for my father to relax when he couldn't keep up with the rest of us - he is 75 and likes to relax with an odd tipple!! - we are Irish after all!! Anyway, to get with the niitty gritty, I would say I had an enjoyable time at the San Francesco. We walked everywhere and it does take about about 25 mins to get to the Vittoriia Emmanuel Monument which is beside the Forum. The hotel is very clean, staff very friendly, very little bar facilities for a nightcap/no atmosphere or people to chat to as it wasn't laid out in that way, breakfast was very enjoyable for a continental - don't expect any cooked food! Coffee excellent! Our room was very small and looked very worn. For a long stay of about a week there was not enough hanging space for clothes. The bathroom was a good size - nearly the size of the bedroom! Linen was changed and very happy with the staff. Overall very enjoyable time but thought it was very expensive for the facilities it offered.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel with good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Retiredtraveller45
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more helpful. They were friendly and suggested ways of getting around the city instead of walking because of the very wet weather. The breakfasts were extensive with plenty of choice. The rooms were cosy and very clean, bath towels changed daily with changes of bedlinen every other day. Trastevere has several good restaurants with very different approaches to their clientele but all with good food at a reasonable price. In better weather we would have walked about the city but, with the advice of the reception staff, we used the buses and trams with great success visiting most of the famous sites of the city.In fine weather we believe that most of the city could have been visited on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, good service”
Reviews.Author: RickTrolled
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francesco was one of the good surprises we had on our trip to Italy - not only it is a clean, cozy hotel located on a charming neighborhood, but it has got some nice facilities as well (a really comfortable breakfast room, polite and welcoming staff, reliable heat system and spacious rooms). Trastevere also proved to be an amazing place to be - even though the main tourist hubs arent located there, all of them are a short walk away from the hotel (30 min. max), with the sights on the way well worth the time spent walking (there's a long line of medieval churches all the way from the hotel to Piazza San Pietro). Besides this, food is usually cheaper and of better quality there than near the main roman sights, and the hotel staff was kind enough to give us directions to good venues nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It is a beautiful hotel with excellent service and the reception desk is very helpful”
Reviews.Author: GreeceGreek
Reviews.Content: 1. Use the tram No. 8 and the buses for your transportation. 2. Ask the receptionist if you have any question about the city, the answer you' ll take it will be the right one. 3. If you want to eat great food go to tratoria or pizzeria. In Trastevere area the "La Tana" and the "ill Duke" is very good. 4. Ask from the reception to give you the tourist map.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in a quiet corner of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: City99
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a quiet corner of the otherwise bustling Trastevere district, a block or so away from the Tiber, this hotel totally lived up to the reports from previous postings on TripAdvisor. There were only a few reminders that the hotel was once a seminary; however you can hear the sound of the bells from the adjacent church (which weren't a problem at night but do help you to get up in the morning) and the view at the back of the hotel looks out over a small cloister. We found the staff to be courteous and friendly. Parking cost around €25 per night in the garage just down the next street, and there was a small good value supermarket down at the end of another street leading away from the hotel. During our stay we used a variety of public transport-the nearby tram on Viale di Trastevere which takes you to Largo Argentina was most convenient for reaching the Central area, though we also used a bus from just across the Tiber to the Vatican which took 45 minutes. The hotel is pretty far from the Metro however, the nearest stations took at least 25 minutes to reach by foot. Trastevere was very lively and fun in the evening and was only a brisk 10 minute walk away from the hotel. The immediate vicinity around the hotel felt relatively safe, though after dark was a little on the quiet side. The lobby was decorated in a grand style, but the room we had was less so. There were some nice features, such as a large bathroom with tub and good quality toiletries, comfortable beds and big fluffy pillows, but the lighting was a little drab, the bedroom was on the small side and the TV was outdated. As other reviewers had noted, the Wifi was temperamental. However, the room was clean and the air conditioning worked well. We were particularly impressed with the roof terrace, which was a lovely place to sit for a drink or two before bedtime, under a large canvas canopy and looking out over the Aventine Hill. The service up there was charming too. Breakfast was also of a good quality with a nice buffet laid out on the ground floor looking out over the cloister. Our overall impression of the hotel was positive and the hotel definitely met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent place!”
Reviews.Author: Geirogco
Reviews.Content: Typical italian hotel . Clean rooms and a good breakfast. (a lot of cakes..!) We could walk to the city, the staff where friendly and they have a beautiful place at the top.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Keith_Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the San Francesco and came away feeling fortunate to have discovered this gem of a hotel. This is the perfect "3-star experience" for those who don't require the luxury of a 5-star hotel, but want something better than bare-bones budget accommodation. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, the room clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom modern. The breakfast was an impressive array of breads, pastries, cheeses, meats, yogurt, and cereal. Each carafe of coffee is prepared individual and served alongside steamed milk. The location can't be beat. I'll definitely be staying at the San Francesco on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice (but typical internet hassle)”
Reviews.Author: CyrusL
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good quiet location, away from the immediate hustle bustle but still close to the heart of things. If you are healthy, you can easily walk to all the sites in Rome. Even the Vatican and Spanish Steps are not that far away; we never took a bus, a tram, or any other transportation. Our room was somewhat small but the ceiling was high and the third floor view over the neighboring convent was pleasing, especially at sunset. Arguably the bathroom is nicer than the bedroom -- spacious, with a big shower, a friendly sky colored motif, and a big window for good ventilation. Moreover, the bed was good, not overly firm like most Italian beds. It was also a true queen rather than two singles pushed together which sadly is often the case for so-called matrimonial beds. The walls were a bit thin, but our neighbors were mostly quiet. Also, even though the area is generally quiet, the convent bells begin ringing at 7 am; it might take a couple of nights to learn to sleep through them. Breakfast was mediocre relative to other Italian hotels that we stayed in. But you can get a cheap and much better cappuccino and pastry at the nearest bar on Via di San Fransesco a Ripa and see a little of the local culture, especially between about 9 and 9:30 am. There is also an organic store near the bar and a little supermarket on Via Carlo Tavolacci where you can purchase fruit to round out breakfast. When the concierge saw us return with food one morning he seem to nod to himself as in "oh yes, they have figured it out" unlike the Germans hurrying down to breakfast room at the crack of dawn. Via di San Fransesco a Ripa also has a laundry. Two minor issues. This hotel is stingy with soap. We had to share one little bar between the shower and the sink. After three days we had finally worked up to a nearly new bar in both the shower and on the sink. It felt like a triumph. Then there is the internet. It's free but as in most Italian hotels it is a hassle. I don't understand why Italian hotels can't just hand out a WEP/WPA key and perhaps change it once a month or week. Instead many of them have subscribed to a tedious system where you receive a ticket with a username and password good for say 24 hours. Both the username and password are eight (or maybe nine) characters and contain a tedious mix of lowercase and numbers, more suitable to a bank or trading account than mere internet access. Moreover, the system automatically logs you out after some period of inactivity, perhaps an hour, and it often seems necessary to reenter the tedious username and password (I was using an iPod touch). And the same username and password can only be use for one device (MAC address) at once meaning you would need to get a separate one if say both you and your partner have communication devices. Moreover, if you switch between WiFi connections (technically SSIDs) to get a better signal, the system sometimes gets confused and will not even let you get to the http://1.1.1.1/info.html page that shows your connection status. One day I got things to work only by changing the MAC address on my device but inasmuch as that required a jailbroken device and technical know-how, it will be beyond most users.

Reviews.Title: “Charming friendly hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: DeborahJaneCanberra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-placed in Trastevere, the room we had was nice and airy, with a window you could open and a view; nice bed, clean and spacious bathroom and good bedlinen. The breakfast was terrific: delicious, generous, varied and healthy, and the breakfast room was a delight. Good coffee too. The reception staff were all terrific: helpful, pleasant and friendly. The roof bar was lovely and a very nice place to be at the end of a long day walking around Rome. We felt very much at home there and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and choosed it after reading all the positive rewievs on this site. Overall I think this is a great hotel: it´s charming, nice and clean. And the service is in the reception was fantastic, they helped us in every way. The location is ok - near the tram to the city core. The rooms are not so big, ant it was a bit cold in the evening. But that was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite As Good as Hoped”
Reviews.Author: SDY
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel San Francesco and had a nice stay although we were a little disappointed in the hotel. The furniture in our room was very beaten-up and the rooms were not as clean as one would expect for the prices we paid. The location is fine, but a little south of the actual Trastevere neighbourhood, so you need to walk a few minutes to actually get into the real Trastevere. Overall, it is a pretty easy place from which to get around in Rome. You can get most places within 20 minutes of easy walking. The rooftop terrace is lovely and a great place for a drink in the evening before you go out for dinner. The breakfast is good, but the dining room is a little small and we sometimes had to wait for a table. It's a nice hotel but I think a little over-priced (at least on the weekends).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: kingen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy that included 3 nights in Rome. After an extensive search for a hotel, I selected the Hotel San Francesco mainly for it's location and for the great reviews by other TripAdvisor members. We were not disappointed. The service at the front desk was the best I have received at any hotel in Europe -- friendly, responsive, incredibly helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and wonderful. Our room at the back of the hotel was so quiet and peaceful, though in typical European fashion, smaller than what Americans are used to. The location in Trastevere was ideal, within walking distance of all key sites. On top of all that, this hotel is an outstanding value. In summary, if you're looking for a great hotel at a great price in a fantastic part of Rome, Hotel San Francesco is the place.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will exceed all of your expectations! Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Nani07
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations, before travelling we read good and bad reviews about San Francesco but on return we only have good things to say about it. The location of the hotel was perfect.....we walked to all the attractions: vatican, colosseum, trevi fountain, piazza navona, pantheon and the spanish steps. Trastevere is filled with narrow cobbled streets, authentic restaurants and excellent ice cream places. We felt like we were in real italy living amongst the locals which made our experience even more special. The Hotel was clean and comfortable with excellent staff who were polite, friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and a great base to have after a long days sightseeing. The bathroom was big, bright and modern which was a big plus for us. The breakfast was great, lots of things to choose from, continually being replenished by staff....it really gave us a good start to our days. The roof terrace was a great space to soak up the sun during the day or relax under the stars at night. To summarise this hotel is perfect for those wanting a friendly, atmospheric, clean, comfortable base from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: SkyChilli
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than met my expectations (which were high anyway given the mostly positive reviews on this site). The location, on the quiet side of Trastevere, is great, being away from (but within walking distance) of the main touristy bits, surrounded by quaint narrow streets and with lots of buzzy restaurants and bars. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The reception area and roof bar are chic, the bedrooms, although small, have high ceilings and the bathrooms are spacious. We booked through Expedia, and got a deal that was really good value for money and worked out at about €100 a room a night including breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: marisa72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at San Francesco. The rooms were spacious (for Europe) and clean. The breakfast has a wonderful selection of items - sure to find something that you like. Lovely view from the rooftop terrace. Only downside was the unenthusiastic staff - they were polite but not particularly helpful. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended to friends. My favourite area in Rome by far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet Trastevere location”
Reviews.Author: quesochica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of trip and were ready for some relaxation. And since our room overlooked the serene convent next door, we definitely got it. The hotel was an easy walk to the tram and a moderate walk to the restaurant and bar hot spots of the neighborhood. Our room was kind of small but it was nice and the bathroom was great. If you are going to run around and do the tourist hotspots of Rome, you may want to choose another neighborhood. But we wanted to wander and eat.. and this hotel offered us a great homebase for doing that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: zingaraChicago
Reviews.Content: The location (Trastevere) is so much less touristy than other areas of Rome. The hotel is very nice with a gorgeous rooftop bar. But best of all the staff was the most helpful and thoughtful I've ever encountered in Rome. There was a problem with the air conditioning vent in our room the first night, and the next morning they took care of getting us a new room and moving us to it while we were out siteseeing. All of the staff was friendly and full of suggestions for visiting Rome. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location couple with perfect hospitality”
Reviews.Author: papajimNapa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Francesco in the Trastevere neighborhoods of old Rome is the absolute perfect location from which to explore this remarkably walkable city. The hotel is a hidden jem of hospitality with a jewel of a staff who helped us from our first contact until we left. They promptly answered my many emails and helped make sure our first trip to Rome will NOT be our last. And will we ALWAYS stay with our new "family" at the Hotel San Francesco. If you like to walk, you want a delicious, hearty breakfast each morning and a clean and comfortable room to return to each night you simply must stay at this charming 24 room hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a few nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alanmsq
Reviews.Content: I say good base for a few nights because if you're in Rome for just a short time, chances are that, like us, you'll be out and about for most of the day, eating out in the evening and using the hotel as a comfortable start and finish to your day. You'll also want to be in a good location for touring the city and walking to restaurants, but not perhaps right in the busy centre. On these counts, the Hotel San Francesco scores well. Previous reviews have been a bit mixed, so I'll try to put the hotel into some context here. It describes itself as a boutique hotel. I'm not exactly sure what that constitutes, but the description may be a little exaggerated. Our bedroom wasn't large and was rather dourly decorated and a little worn, as was the bathroom, though this was generously sized. Some of the common areas, particularly the stairways, are in need of some decoration. The reception area and breakfast room are light and pleasant though. Breakfast itself was varied and plentiful by Italian standards and served from 7.00am, allowing for early assault on the city if you chose (handy when temperatures climb as high as when we were there). We found the staff to be helpful and efficient throughout our short stay - providing maps, advice about bus stops and booking a return airport taxi for us. A great asset is the hotel's roof terrace which is especially pleasant in the evening for a drink before or after dinner. Yes, the seats could be a bit cleaner (but it's an outdoor terrace) and yes, it overlooks its near neighbours' rooftops, which include some satellite dishes. But it also offers views of the distant Rome skyline, the clear starry sky and the the occasionally tolling bell of the nextdoor church. How you see it depends on the romantic in you I suppose! Some previous comments about the location are rather unfair. Trastevere is a lovely district of Rome, with a lived-in as much as touristy feel. The hotel is situated off a small square and attached to a convent. People of all ages wander around in the evening and at no point did we feel in the slightest degree wary or intimidated (apart from dodging the odd scooter!) There's a frequented-by-locals trattoria just across the square and an enormous choice of restaurants is within a 10-minute walk. The river is also just 10 minutes away, nearest tour-bus stop is 15 minutes walk. We walked to the Colosseum from the hotel in 30 minutes. This is a case of 'you pay your money, your take your choice'. If we'd paid €200 a night we might have been a bit disappointed, but at €79 a night in July in a great location in a major European city we were suitably impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: nycpm
Reviews.Content: A lovely small hotel in Trastevere within walking distance of all of Rome's attractions with fabulous service, delicious breakfasts, and a pretty rooftop garden to catch the evening's breezes.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: DBSTexas
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised to read the bad review. We had an excellent stay. The room was certainly adequate. There were three of us in one room so we had a rollaway. We still had room to maneuver and get to our suitcases. I found the bathroom a very nice size especially for Europe. We stayed 2 nights and our room was immaculate both days. The staff was very nice and ther front desk was more than willing to answer any questions and direct us on our way. The first night we left our window open and I must admit there was street noise (mostly cars). We remeedied this the second night by closing the window and it was NOT too hot to sleep. The breakfast was great to get us to start the day. I must admit the coffee was VERY strong. The location was great. The front desk provided us with a map (and starred our hotel location) so we never got lost. The longest walk was to St. Peters. That probably took us 45 minutes. The Pantheon was only about 20 minutes. We never used tht public transportation. We walked everywhere. Of course we were beat by the end of the day. We thoroughly enjoyed the roof top bar. The view was great and it was slighly cool in the evening. We enjoyed having to wear a sweater as we live in Texas. The only problem I had was I asked the bartender the price of a glass of wine. I was sure he said 2 Euros but when we paid the final bill a glass was 7 euros each. Thus our bar bill was higher than we expected but we were on vacation and we enjoyed it , so I just paid the bill. Be sure to verify the cost before you over endulge!! We loved the neighborhood. It was so nice to get away from the "tourist" crowds. We would just wander around looking for places to eat. We enjoyed all of the restauants we ate at . The best buy at all the restaurants was the wine!!! One night we stopped at a small store for gelato. They were out of chocolate but asked me to wait and they would make it for me. It probably took 25 minutes but it was worth the wait. I would definitely recommend this hotel and this neighborhood to everyone. If I ever get back to Rome I would stay here again. I am a Travel Agent and this will go on my recommended list for clients traveling to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Run away as fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTheGreek
Reviews.Content: First off the neighborhood this place is in is awful. Downright scary. All the buildings are covered in graffitti and there's homeless people everywhere. The neighborhood is absolutely filthy. The front desk clerk was extrememly rude. The pictures on their website were very misleading. The room was VERY small and there was mold everywhere in the shower. The views from the rooms were awful as well. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. The "rooftop bar" was a joke. The chairs were all filthy, the plants were all dead, and the view was only of rooftops of buildings with tv antennas. Do yourself a favor and RUN.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience, Disgusting Room, Mold Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: spettypi
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough BAD things. We thought the room was a little dingy at first - dinged up furniture, stains on carpet, uncomfertable bed, but were willing to deal. Soon we realized the air conditioning didn't work and the person at the front desk refused to help. But still we were willing to deal. But the final straw was when I got in the shower the next morning and realized that the black bathroom tile was actually COVERED in mold and the brush of my hand sent all sorts of black mold off the wall. Next i looked up and could see cob webs in the corner of the shower. We moved out of the room an hour later. I have never written a bad review of a hotel before but this was needed. I'll deal with a lot, but not filthy rooms. I don't understand all the positive postings. The lobby was nice and they did have an okay roof top bar that was about all that was good. The neighborhood was also dirty and loud. This is the type of hotel I would expect for $50 a night in Eastern Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Well located in Trestavere- Close to the Action and Good Transportation.”
Reviews.Author: 110210b
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel base on a combination of Trip Advisor High Rating and Confirming information in Pauline Frommers Italy. Since this is the only time my wife and I have been to Europe, we can not compare the size of the Rooms. From reading many comments about other Hotels, I would say that the rooms are small but adequate for travelers ( We had space for our suitcases and a warddrobe). Our linen was changed each day ( double Mattresses and PIlows), the bathrooms ( showers, not tub, recently remodeled) and towels ( bathsheets) were cleaned ( very tidy and met my wife'r high expectations). There was a good hair Dryer and soap, shampoo, shower cap and shoe polishing pad ( which were renewed each day). We had a full breakfast bar every morning ( bacon and eggs, yogurt, cereal, fruits, granola, Strong Coffee ( according to my wife who is a Starbucks-Bold Fan) Expresso or Capacino and assorted Teas. Each Morning we left the Hotel very well fed . The hotel is a block and half away from "major bus and tram" locations as well as two blocks and a half from "the actions" in Trestavere Eating areas. We found the staff to be extremely cooperative, any time of day. There was internet access availble in a room next to the Reception Desk. If we ever had the opportunity to go to Rome again, we would definitely stay there againd.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Walking tours”
Reviews.Author: MUMom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights at the San Francesco. It's in a great (funky) Greenwich-Village type neighborhood loaded with terrific restaurants and local flavor. We loved the hotel - very clean, comfortable and a great spot. We had only two days and we were able to walk (a couple of miles) to the Vatican one day and the other day walked to the Coliseum, Forum and Palatine Hill. If you don't mind walking on those ancient cobblestone streets its a level walk, although you might find it a bit far to the Vatican, especially walking back! The breakfast at the hotel was lavish by any standard. And, free computer access in the lobby was very helpful. Overall, we'd highly recommend it. Rooms on the back of the hotel open to a convent garden, which I would expect would be quite a bit quieter with the windows open. We were on the fourth floor and had quite a bit of traffic noise when the windows were open, but you're in a city, so what do you expect!?

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: mhs77
Reviews.Content: Excellent, helpful staff.....the breakfast is lovely with many food item choices. The rooms are very clean. I especially thought the bathrooms were nice, clean, and larger than most. Great location to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: fun_food_wine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel SF on 2 different occasions during our trip to Italy. I found the comments on trip advisor to be very accurate (you never know). Good location, close walking distance to the major sites and numerous trattorias, friendly/helpful staff. The rooms while small by American standards were clean and comfortable and are in line with other hotels we stayed at during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “We felt at home”
Reviews.Author: StopForDirections
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Fracesco for three days in July. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our flight arrived very early from New York City (7 am) and they gave us our room, which was great because we were so exhausted. The hotel is on the fringe of the Travestere, but all of the sights were relatively close and there are several decent places to eat in the area. The only downside was minimal A/C. It was so hot the last day of our stay we have to leave the mini bar open to cool the room. Not neccessarily a deal breaker (more of a tip!).

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back tomorrow....”
Reviews.Author: fishangel
Reviews.Content: We (my extended family, age range 13 - 84) stayed here for 4 days just before Christmas. Everyone was happy! That says it all, really. The hotel is slightly outside the more touristy part of Trastevere, and none the worse for that - and is well placed for reaching all the sites provided you can cope with public transport ( take bus [used to be tram] 3 for the Colosseum, the Palatino and Testaccio; tram 8 for Largo Argentina, both have stops very close to the hotel - bus stop for bus to the Vatican somewhat further away and harder to find, but still within walking distance) ; hotel staff were incredibly helpful, patient, and generous with their time; breakfasts were both substantial and delicious; water hot, rooms were warm (not always the way in Rome in winter) - and no smaller than is usual (!). We would all happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value/ service / location”
Reviews.Author: tsparis
Reviews.Content: Very well located small friendly hotel, in which we spent 4 nights between christmas and new year day. Trastevere is the hype roma area, and the hotel is very well located. Near a lot of good and typic italian restaurants, and near the historic center (2 tram stations). The tram station is 50m from the hotel, and in 5 min, you are in Piazza Navona, or Trevi. The rooms are good, clean and quiet. Not luxurious, but fair for the price. The breakfast is also good, as the room, no more comments. Good for a 3 stars international standards. I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KayRenee
Reviews.Content: Perfect little hotel in the most picturesque neighborhood in Rome --the Trastevere. We had a cozy room on the top floor that had a large bathroom with a tub, lovely to have after a long day of sightseeing. Good breakfast in charming room looking out on a monastery's garden. Wonderful, quiet location. Front desk extremely nice and helpful in all respects. We will never stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBBBB12345
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our honeymoon in this hotel. Room was very comfortable, with a big bathroom and a bit of a view of the monk's garden next door. Breakfasts were good, and staff were very friendly and helpful (e.g. calling airline to chase up our lost luggage for us). There's a minibar in the room and an internet terminal downstairs. It's easy to get into town by bus from the hotel, and there are restaurants etc. nearby.

Reviews.Title: “slightly expensive for location”
Reviews.Author: rk2100
