Reviews.Content: nice, neat clean boutique hotel. very friendly staff. mostly only 1 guy on duty. slightly expensive as 20 min away from station. Also quite far from quite a few important locations. breakfast also not too sumptous. but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for price”
Reviews.Author: DonFinlayson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, being our second visit to Rome. Last visit was a slightly more expensive hotel very close to the Colloseum. In terms of the location, Hotel SF wins. Trastevere is really a Rome must see, being a quaint oldworld type of neighbourhood with a lot of peeling paint and character. There are a fair number of cafes and eateries within walking distance, but not exactly at the hotel's doorstep. From Trastevere you can trek to most of Rome's top sites without getting too exhausted. The hotel is located on a side street, and the room we had (top floor facing rear) was quiet. The room was very small and the decor was dark. Staff were ok, not overly friendly. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet - cold meats, breads, cereals etc. There was also a bacon egg option. Typical for Italy, you get 1 small cup of coffee - so you have to relish it, but don't fret there is a few cheap cafes nearby to top up after breakfast. From memory, I think I picked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and the price. It was quite acceptable for a short stay, and the location was good. With so much choice for hotels in Rome, whilst not totally disappointed, I probably would try another hotel if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location: Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: treacleminer
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel a great deal. The Trastevere location was both charming and handy. Those places we couldn't walk to we could easy catch the tram to, or hop on one of the open-top buses to reach. The hotel itself is not your usual 'business traveler' hotel. The rooms could be described as a little small - but then is a converted seminary. There's free WiFi & decent internet for anyone who asks too, which is still rare. Otherwise: clean, quiet & comfortable. We'd stay here again. Traveller Tip: get a decent map & explore Trastevere on foot. It's an undiscovered gem with plenty of lovely places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbman1
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel located in a great local neighborhood but close to both Rome attractions and the Vatican. Room was great and decent size. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Rooftop garden provided for a nice end of day retreat. The biggest surprise was the GREAT breakfast buffet that came with the room. Would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minandsash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a friends recommendation. We booked our first and last night here. We were cycling through Umbria and needed a base for the airport and our bike bags. Reception staff were very helpfull and our bike bags were left for 8 days in the left luggage room at no charge and were still there 8 days later. Our room was very clean, if a bit small, bathroom was was very swish and clean. Air con worked great which was good as it was very hot. Breakfast was one of the best we had on our 8 day cycling trip, eggs, bacon, cheese, cold meats, cakes, fresh friut, bread etc. Location is very good, within walking distance to all the great sights, and some very good bars and resturants. It has a roof terrace but we didn't have a drink there as it was always closed when we arrived back at the hotel in the early hours, however we did go up to it when it was closed, the views over the roof tops is well worth a visit. I would recommend this hotel for its excellent location and breakfast, great value for money in a very nice area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orviet0
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay in this lovely little hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful, even allowing us to check in early. The rooms were quite small but nicely fitted and very clean. Really good modern bath or shower rooms. The hotel had a lovely rooftop terrace and bar with stunning views across Rome. No restaurant but an excellent buffet breakfast was provided each morning. Very highly recommended and an ideal base for exploring all the sights of Rome which are all accessible on foot.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Hotel in one of Rome's great locations”
Reviews.Author: BruceFraser
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights at the Hotel San Fancesco in the Trastevere section of Rome. This is an excellent modest-sized hotel, in a quieter but 'fun' part of Rome (restaurants, shops, etc.) with very good transportation links to the City's main sites and attractions. The staff and service were all excellent, the roof-top terrace was a great feature, with good views....greater summer breezes...and an excellent member of staff looking after guests' refreshment needs. A great setting for pre- or post-dinner drinks. Our room was on the small'ish size...but otherwise everything about the hotel more than met our expectations and needs. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ryBuff
Reviews.Content: Booked for a one week family holiday in Rome due to favourable reviews on Tripadvisor. Very impressed. Clean rooms, well equipped with comfortable bed and good bathroom....although main bedroom is described as 'boutique'..smallish. Air conditioning efficient. Staff were approachable and efficient . Well above average breakfasts (interesting mix of European expectations of what's on the menu...not typical English breakfast but includes Egg and Bacon). Site is good with interesting selection of local shops and reataurants in Trastevere. Reasonable walking access to the historic Roman sites and right next to the Number 3 tram route (1 Euro tickets obtainable from tobaconist stands) for all the other sites. Altogether a recommended choice to see Rome

Reviews.Title: “A Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: daspler1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hotel San Francesco at the beginning of our trip to Italy and had a great time. The hotel is in a great area called Trastevere and there are many great restaurants nearby. Most of Rome's main attractions are within walking distance. Like with the rest of Italy there are tons of places to eat pasta, pizza, and gelato. The rooms were a good size and colourful. The staff was very helpful, including Renato who is the barman on the rooftop terrace. We loved going up there, enjoying drinks and snacks before going out to eat dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely find”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeckyB
Reviews.Content: What great Hotel. I stayed in this hotel on my trip around Europe with my husband. I booked a different hotel originally, however they emailed me to cancel as they had trouble with their water and Air con. I found this hotel searching through Trip advisor as I wanted to stay in Trastevere. The hotel itself is really cool. The chap on reception is so helpful and gave us lots of useful information. The rooms are great, small but comfortable. The roof bar is amazing, it is a must for anyone visiting Rome. The hotel is situated in a great location, very quiet and residential, however there are little Trattoria's on every corner. It is a little bit away from the sights, but everything is in walking distance in Rome. Bus 75 takes you direct to Termini Station. We ate in two excellent restaurants in Trastevere, one is called Al Marmi and on the main road, it doesn't look that appealing, but is always busy and the waiters are so busy. The do the best Roman pizza, super thin and only 6 euros each. The next night we ate at a Alle Frette de Trastevere on Via San Fransesco. The owner speaks excellent English and is very inviting. On the night we ate there, Trastevere was having an annual festival of the Madonna and there was a parade down all the streets with a band and many of the town's folk. The Breakfast is also worth a mention, there must be 15 different pastries, delicious eggs and fresh fruit. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again when I return to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Francesco is a must when visiting Rome....”
Reviews.Author: jennyd8
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four from London visiting Rome for a few days and this hotel was recommended by a friend - who works nearby! The hotel was in an excellent area for touring the city, it was exceptionally clean and our rooms were just perfect - clean towels etc every day and lots of hot water - our rooms overlooked a beautiful courtyard at the back. The breakfast table had a very large variety of wonderful and tempting foods to try ...... and plenty of it too!! The reception/staff were most helpful, kind and always smiling - especially Massimo. We will visit Rome again, stay in the San Francesco and would certainly recommend this hotel - a 5* accommodation. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable. Jenny/Donovan/Vanessa & Neville

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Hotel San Francesco”
Reviews.Author: Andreafef
Reviews.Content: We (couple in our late 20's) stayed at the Hotel San Francesco for 4 nights and were not disappointed. The hotel is a very clean, affordable option. I had requested a room overlooking the courtyard with a shower prior to arriving, and that is exactly what we got. The rooms are small, but as everyone has said your never in the room. There is a minimal amount of wear and tear and we did have a little mold on the shower doors, but nothing that was a deal breaker. The front desk staff were always happy and pleasant. Even when we locked the key in the room. The free computer access in the lobby is a really nice touch. Even though the rooftop bar was closed we saw guests getting drinks at the lobby bar and taking them up. Our first afternoon we had pizza and wine there and enjoyed the views. The biggest selling point is the breakfast. The coffee was excellent, and the food was great. There were 2 types of eggs, breads, cheeses, pastries, croissants (plain & w/filling), cereals, meat, cheese, fruit, & juices. Some days we didn't get to breakfast until closer to 10 and they were still replenishing the buffet. Staying in Trastevere was out of the tourist zone and a fun neighborhood. The street San Francesco a Ripa had a gelato shop that we went to everyday, a pizza/snack counter, a very good wine store, and one of our best dinners, Pizza Ivo a fun casual pizza place. It would have been nice to be a little closer to the main sites, but for what you get for the money it was definitely worth it, plus the tram runs right across the river if you need it. We walked absolutely everywhere and are in good shape but definitely felt pains in our bodies that we never felt before!! Overall, I recommend the Hotel San Francesco to anyone that doesn't mind being out of the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria010
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in Trastevere, Rome. Staff very helpful with recommendations for restaurants, how to get around, buses etc., Trastevere is a lovely place, restaurants very reasonable and safe to walk around. Also very convenient for getting around, just walk across river and all the sights very reachable. If you want a nice place to stay while in Rome would recommend Hotel San Francesco. We got a two day ticket for hop on hop off bus, great to just stay on first day and then you know where to get on and off next day, covers all the places you would want to see.

Reviews.Title: “hidden but nice”
Reviews.Author: tickettime
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in Trastevere. The bridges make excellent landmarks so you don't get lost. Hotel is hard to find because it's so nondescript from the street, but it's on a quiet street and easily accessible to all of Rome. The tram is close by on the main street -Trastevere. The room overlooked the churches garden next door and was pleasant to look at. (Also vist the church -it's steps away.) The room was European small with almost no closet space, but it was always clean. Sound proofing isn't the greatest- but we didn't have many problems from that. The breakfast buffet was delicious- and don't miss the fried eggs- they're smothered in butter. There is free computer use for E Mails. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: PhillipaNeck
Reviews.Content: We had been tipped off by those in-the-know that Trastevere is THE district to stay in when visiting Rome. How right they are! Ideal if you're happy to walk everywhere (if you hate to put one foot in front of the other, stay near the Trevi/the Spanish steps/thePantheon or Piazza Navona - it's tourist hell, but you'll be near the big stuff). In Trastevere you'll be living among the locals - loads of fabulous little pizzerias and trattorias in narrow cobbled streets and far from the madding tourist crowd. An effortless 20-30 minutes of walking will take you to most sites - unless spectacularly unfit, you really won't feel the trek as the surroundings are so captivating. Maybe I enjoyed being south of the Tiber as I'm a South Londoner, so it felt like coming home! For eating choices in the evening, you're unbelievably spoilt within 2 minutes of the hotel - Indian, Greek, Chinese ... but when in Italy, we stuck to the local fayre! About the hotel - our stay was slightly marred by being allocated a room which STANK of damp and had very noisy electrical equipment above it. We're a bit miffed that the receptionist selected it for us - did we look like we deserved it?!? Anyway, avoid 406 at all costs - it is damp and has a nasty dog-leg cut into it to accommodate next door's bathroom (presumably). We plucked up the courage to ask for a room change, and were allocated 304 - much better. Always ensure you have a room on the garden side - you overlook a very pretty convent garden rather than the street, and as long as you don't mind being woken by the convent bell at 7, you're definitely on the quietest, prettiest side for your stay! The fittings (windows, bathroom, etc.) are all good quality, but the decor is rather tired and feels a bit 80s in places. The entrance lobby is quite funky, the roof-terrace is fab (its bar wasn't functioning when we were there - didn't matter) but the bedrooms are just in need of a bit of TLC. The bathrooms, though spacious and well-fitted, have horrible sponged paint-effect walls above the waist-height tiles - your towels will be changed every day, so they haven't quite gone green yet. The beds are very comfortable with excellent quality linen and pillows. The breakfast is lovely - lots of fresh fruit, bacon and eggs, cereals ... but do people really eat cake and biscuits that early in the morning?! Some of the staff were very friendly and all spoke English (although we have a smattering of Italian and didn't expect English) but we are still mystified as to our initial receptionist and his allocation of the grim 406. Oh, and if you haven't read other travellers' warnings - don't expect any large hotel rooms in Rome and you won't be disappointed! This bills itself as a boutique hotel, which is pushing it a bit, it is brilliantly situated for all the culinary delights of Trastevere, only the equivalent Santa Maria is better-placed, but somewhat noisier according to the reviews. Trastevere rocks, and the San Francesco tries to keep up, but it just feels a little unloved - I'd still recommend it ... enjoy! (We paid £130 a night by booking direct with the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tara07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March and had a terrific time. It is well situated in the Trastevere district of Rome with several restaurants and bars closeby. All of Rome's major attractions are within 30 minutes walk, or there is a bus stop very closeby to the hotel. The room was quite small but well decorated. I would recommend a room facing the courtyard, as it is quiet and the views of the orange trees are lovely. The bathroom was large and very nice. Hotel staff were helpful. The breakfast was buffet style with lots of options, and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hynes57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of February 2008, with my cousin and her 7 year old daughter. We booked a triple room which was very spacious with a good size ensuite, and spotless, they even provided mints/sweets. The staff were all very friendly and spoke excellent english and never cringed (outwardly anyway) at our attempts at italian! The roof bar is a great place to sit and relax and take in the views. We found the area very good for restaurants and had a great buzz at night and very safe. We walked everywhere. Rome looks huge but everywhere is walkable. I would definatley stay at this hotel again and/or recommend it. New travellers to Rome: Graffetti is everywhere it does mean an area is good, bad or indifferent, the only area that escapes is the Vatican City (presumably because of fear of the wrath of god!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great comfort”
Reviews.Author: vitabella
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel based on Tripadvisor's travelers comments and we were delighted. Location in Trastevere was awesome, walking distance to all sites and transports,wonderferful trattorias and pizzeria's just around the corner. Hotel room was extremely clean and comfortable and breakfasts was a treat. The hotel staff were very helpful. The only caveat is that our room was rather small but nonetheless comfortable. This was our first time at this hotel and we're going back asap!

Reviews.Title: “Warmth in December”
Reviews.Author: Erfelisss
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days in cold December, first thing to say nice air conditioning, second: nice bathroom, third: nice breakfast. I could go on in numbers till 7 or 8. The hotel is quite good value for money, that will obviously depend on how much you pay for night but if you pay less than a 100€ for a double on low season I would tell you to go for the hotel. Spotless, located very near Trastevere "hot" area and a 20-30 minutes’ walk to places like Coliseum, Palazzio Farnese or Bocca della Veritá. I would not say that hotel staff is jumping with joy like elves meeting Santa when you ask them something but they are kind, professional and will help you. I did not find those shabby dark areas and worn around the edges furniture some travelers spoke about and although you will not be able to play a tennis match on the room its size is ok if you just want to stay there to sleep and have a break before dinner. After all why would you want to stay in your hotel the whole day if you are in Rome. A capital crime this hotel will help you not to commit.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sailwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night at the end of a Rome, Florence trip. We started the trip in Rome and stayed at a different hotel first part of the trip but decided we wanted to try another area of Rome when we came back at the end. The hotel was basic and our standard room was very, very small, room was clean although a little worn around the edges. Bathroom was adequete. Staff answered our questions but would not describe them as friendly or going out of the way to be of assistance. We selected this hotel based upon a positive review in the New York Times and we were certainly disapointed based on that reveiw and compared to other small hotels we have stayed at in Europe for similar prices. I think this sums up our feelings, we paid E 50 more a night at the other hotel in Rome and based upon the 2 we thought the higher priced hotel was a bargain considering the amenities, staff, condition of hotel, etc. compared to the San Francesco. We would not stay at this hotel again given the many choices in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kirkcaldy67
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I stayed at the Hotel San Francesco for 6 nights at the end of September 2007 and had a great time. From our airport pick-up to airport departure, everything went smoothly. We checked in 4 hours early for our room and were given a place to store our luggage, offered breakfast, a city map and then we were on our way. Trastevere is a great location, charming, full of character, lots of restaurants and a 30 min walk (depending on what you did as you were walking) from most of Rome’s attractions. The Hotel is good value for money, spotlessly clean and the staff were friendly and attentive. Our room was facing the quieter courtyard (as requested) and was a good size (the bathroom is huge) and the breakfast was perfect with eggs, bacon, cold meats, bread, cereal, pasties, fruit juice and as much coffee as you wanted. Tasty fresh tomatoes at the front desk were a nice touch and the roof terrace was a great place to unwind at the end of a tiring day. There are a couple of good restaurants literally within staggering distance of the hotel and many more an easy 10-15 min walk away and with the ever helpful Max and Benedetto at the front desk to guide you, you won’t go hungry. All in all, a great holiday and we WILL be back

Reviews.Title: “Gives you what you need...”
Reviews.Author: mark71Sydney
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in SF on my first visit to Rome. What a place! And the hotel provided everything I wanted. Clean, especially the bathroom, and despite a small sleeping area and strorage, bathroom was well sized. On a 2 night stay in Rome all you do is sleep in your room so this hotel was great. Decent price, roof terrace offers a place to chill and unwind at end of the day and offers a 360 view (of all the cranes too!), breakfast served plenty and more than adequate, but overall the SF is located within minutes walk of Trastevere, which is a wonderfully characteristic area teeming with places to eat and sit and watch. If you are prepared to walk, and Rome is easily viewed this way, you can be at in central Rome, at the Colosseum, Pza Navona, etc after a 20/30 min walk depending on how fast you move or what you stop to take in. Overall, came to Rome not knowing what to expect and hoping to sample some real Rome and this hotel provided it and was not disappointed. It isn't a 5 star palace with fluffy sheets and pillows, but will definitely recommend to others and return. Well done Hotel SF and thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Breakfast and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ManjuCake
Reviews.Content: My thinking on Rome hotels is that they're very much like hotels in London and NYC. Over-priced and small. If you keep this in mind, you won't be disappointed at Hotel San Francesco. Our room on the third floor was very small and dark because of the small, high windows. Our room faced the main street and there was no view except scaffolding across the street. There was some street noise, but we wore ear plugs so that wasn't a problem. The furniture looked worn with scratches here and there. The double bed was very firm, which we like. The bathroom was large and very clean, as was the room itself. Air conditioning worked beautifully. Overall the room was good for sleeping, but didn't have much ambience. That suited us fine since we were hardly ever in our room. Other pluses: the breakfast was excellent with a broad selection. There was sliced fruit, pastries, cereals, ham, cheese, eggs, toast, juice, coffee. It was the best of the five hotels we visited. The service was excellent during breakfast -- efficient and very courteous. Front desk service was outstanding and also efficient though not what I would call warm and friendly. Max specifically was very helpful. Here are some examples of the service he provided/arranged. One day the hair dryer didn't work and after breakfast I mentioned it to Max at the front desk. Back in the room and just 5 minutes later, a temporary dryer was delivered and then later the entire outfit was replaced while we were out of the room sighseeing. One morning I was sick and my husband asked Max if there was an orange that he could bring up to me rather than a glass of OJ from the breakfast bar. Max said he would take care of it. About 10 minutes later, a lovely tray was delivered with a full pot of tea, toast, and two oranges. What a nice surprise and at no charge. Pick-up from the airport was reliable. Though we had to wait in a long line to get through immigration, then another hour for bags, the hotel's arranged car service was still waiting for us two hours after we had landed. We never called once to say we were being delayed. If this had been NYC, we would have been SOL. Overall, for a 3-star hotel, I think this hotel is very satisfactory. This was my second trip to Rome and the Hotel San Francesco was far superior and a much better value than the hotel I stayed at five years ago in the trendy Spanish Steps/Via Condotti area. Trastevere is really a cool, not so touristy area, across the Tiber River. The area has a lot of delightful shops and restaurants and we really enjoyed stay there. Though not close, we did walk to all the major tourist sites and took cabs back to the hotel. Finally, don't forget to check out the roof-top bar. Very cool!

Reviews.Title: “San Francesco - Good Location but-”
Reviews.Author: BDiaz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy, our first 4 nights were at the San Francesco Hotel in Rome. This is a nice hotel, located on the Trastevere area. The place is clean but the rooms are very small and a little overpriced. Our room was looking to the courtyard. The only noise that we heard was from the San Agustin church bells which are behind of the hotel. Their breakfast was the best compare with our other 4 hotels were we stayed. Their breakfast was composed of fried eggs, ham, cold cuts, cheese, breads, pastries, and a variety of fruits, cereals, yogurt, juices and coffee. Their staff is friendly. Most of them speak English. For those who want to take the bus to explore the city, this hotel is very close to the bus stop. The hotel is a 30 minutes walk from the coliseum. The closest metro station is the pyramid stop. A cross the street is a small supermarket where you can buy water or snacks to take with you during your sightseeing. If you are interested in staying in the Trastevere area I will recommend you this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to Rome's most characteristic quarter”
Reviews.Author: Evelin31
Reviews.Content: On choosing any hotel in Rome you have to count on two basic facts: they are overpriced and rooms are way too small (not only compared to US standards). Keeping these in mind, Hotel San Francesco is a good choice among Roman hotels, because even though it is also overpriced with small rooms (which are rather 2-star than 3), the bathrooms in this hotel are of nice size and clean. Ask for a room that looks at the garden (they are more silent and the garden is nice) and that is at the end of the hallway, cause those rooms have a bathroom with a tub. Trust me, it's really relaxing and revitalizing to take a bubble bath following a full-day walk in the city. :-) Other reviews praise the breakfast, but don't have high expectations: it's nicely set but rather simple; cakes and fruit juices are the cheap ones from the supermarkets, and the same selection every day. Staff at the reception - especially Max - is excellent, friendly and helpful beyond the Italian average, I have to say. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Trastevere is definately the most characteristic and charming part of Rome with excellent trattorias in the near on cute little old streets and squares. Max recommended us Paolo's Trattoria right on the next corner, which we tried and I tell you it's really worth it! Nice service, great food. But everyone of you will discover "your own Rome" anyway. We are in our 30s, so the hotel is at good location for us to walk to the major sites, yet for elder travellers it might be too much walk, but tram No. 8 (a ticket costs 1 Euro) stops a 100 meters from the hotel and takes you to Piazza Argentina (take bus 40 from here for e.g. that takes you in 10 minutes to St. Peter's Square), which is right in the near of many sites to see and also to Trastevere train station in the other direction, where the train from and to Fiumicino Airport is at. The hotel is a great choice especially if you arrive at Fiumicino Airport. From Ciampino Airport you'd have to cross the whole city. (No need to waste money on taxi or shuttle service offered by the hotel! Take a train that goes frequently from Fiumicino Airport and take off after about 20 minutes at Trastevere station. Tram No. 8 stops right in front of its building, which takes you to the stop next to San Francesco al Ripa Street, cross the street to the left side (there's a great little wine store on the corner!), walk along to the end of this street that leads you to Assisi St. France Square, turn right (there's Paolo's Trattoria at the corner) and you can already see the hotel. A train ticket costs 6 Euros / person, a tram ticket costs 1 Euro, so from 7 Euros / person you are there at the hotel or at the airport instead of spending 40-50 Euros on taxi or shuttle service. Bear in mind on your returning to the airport when you leave, that you need at least 2 hours to be on the safe side, especially that Fiumicino Airport is surprisingly huge!) All in all, if you want a low-budget accomodation, look for better deals than Hotel San Francesco, but if you have higher but not 4-star expectactations from a hotel and would prefer Trastevere in the near, go ahead and have a pleasant stay in Hotel San Francesco, just like we did. Thank you, guys!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite living up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Harrisons
Reviews.Content: From reading reviews we were expecting a lovely, 'boutique' city hotel, however we were rather disappointed due to our high expectations. The rooms were extremely small and there is little space to put our suitcases (as we had been travelling around Italy prior to arrival). The room was looking rather tired - wallpaper a bit worn in places, bedspread had a small tear and furniture scratched. On the plus side the location is amazing for seeing the real Rome! The roof top bar had fabulous views - so do the courtyard rooms. Bathroom was very spacious. The staff on reception were really really helpful!! Great restaurants and bars close by so you don't need to travel across Rome. The area isn't too touristy either which we found to be a bonus. This hotel is certainly not a boutique hotel which their website claims it to be which is why we haven't rated this hotel. If you are looking for good, clean hotel for a city break, then this will be a good hotel - we were just looking for something a little more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for the historic centre”
Reviews.Author: Nige and Jane
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here at the end of 8 days cycling from Coast to Coast, and overall thought it was a good option well placed for the historical centre and Trastavere. It is on the edge of the latter, and is well organised with reasonably smart accomodation. we had a helpful welcome, and a good dinner recommendation. The roof terrace is nice, although the drinks are a little pricey. The hotel is not on but is very close to the very busy Via Trastavere, and therefore inevitably there is a lot of traffic noise and will not suit those who dislike noise especially at night. We stayed elsewhere during the trip at hotels which were primarily geared to those who like an italian imprint on their food and surroundings - we felt that this hotel oriented itself much more strongly to meeting Northern European and North American needs which will be a positive for some but wasn't for us (all down to personal choice ). In summary, plusses definitely outweigh the minusses but its useful to be aware of the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arado
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to my husband and I by a family member who had just been to Rome. This hotel is in Trastevere, which is on the same side of the river as the Vatican, but across the river from the Roman Forum, Colliseum etc. I would say that you are about a 25-30 minute walk from just about every site that you will want to see. Alternatively there are buses - although we didn't take any. I got the impression that the area itself is on those neighbourhoods that has historically been a less desirable part of the town but has been on the "up and coming" lists the last few years. Personally I would stay here again as it was the only part of Rome that we went to that didn't seem to be overwhelmed by tourists and felt a little more authentic. Our best restaurant experience was in this area. Unfortunately I can't recall the name. The hotel is brand new and although the rooms are quite small, the bathroom is quite large and they are both very clean. I was excited just at the site of shower doors! The breakfast was better than most and in a very cute dining room, where we never had to wait. Although there is an internet connection available, you will not catch a wi-fi signal in your room. We were on the second floor and we spoke with other guests who had the same experience. In the lobby however we were able to connect without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: tulip19
Reviews.Content: Returned home yesterday after spending 3 nights at this hotel with 3 other couples on our first visit to Rome. This is a good hotel in a great location, just enough distance from the centre, with lovely cobbled streets, and great places to eat, you actually feel that you are staying in the true Rome and not somewhere just for tourists. The hotel staff are very kind and helpful and speak excellent english. The rooms are small but who needs bigger, they have everything you need and are clean and attended to daily. The bathrooms are a good size . We asked before arrival if we could have rooms at the back of the hotel as they were reported to have the best outlook, we were not dissapointed. Breakfast is excellent, with lots to choose from and plenty of it. The roof bar is great with beautiful views across Rome, we went up there every night for drinks befor going out to dinner, and really loved it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience the traditional Rome, and would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ghisl
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here for my first time in Rome and I was very pleased overall. Had room 102 facing the courtyard. The room was quite small but the bathroom very spacious. This one had a tub while some of the other rooms did not. My only complaint is that I found the bed much too hard for my liking but after the first couple of nights, I got used to it. The staff was excellent in giving suggestions and directions. The breakfasts were wonderful - best cappucinos I've had than anywhere else in Italy! Location is good if you use tram and bus or you can walk if you like. Trastevere is quaint and wonderful to come home to after a busy day of sightseeing in Rome. I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say enough!”
Reviews.Author: GretaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We did extensive research for our trip to Italy and hoped that our efforts would prove successful. This hotel was everything we had read and more. It is a delightful boutique hotel with modest but very clean rooms, large bathrooms, comfortable beds, beautiful rooftop terrace and excellent location. Try to get a room facing the courtyard. The view is lovely and peaceful. We could walk to delicious trattorias or hop on the bus or tram to all of our planned sightseeing excursions. Breakfast was more than substantial to start us off on our exciting days. We couldn't get over the wonderful flavor of the eggs and blood oranges! Special thanks to Max, "concierge extraordinaire". He helped us locate restaurants, best routes to travel and did everything he could to make our stay a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “superior for Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel San Francesco for my parents' two-night stay in Rome in April, 2007. We were in Room 101. We specifically wanted a hotel in Trastevere, and this offered both comfort and convenience. Check-in was easy, and the staff quiet but friendly. The availability of an internet terminal for free in the lobby was useful, and the breakfast selection was large and delicious. The room was comfortable (though the view of a building covered in scaffolding completely uninteresting), and although the room itself was not especially spacious, it was adequate and the bathroom quite posh. There is a lot of street noise at night if you stay in a room on the front of the building (like room 101), so avoid this if you're a light sleeper. The "seasonal" rooftop bar was not open, but fortunately there was still access to the roof patio, so we bought wine and hors d'oeuvres at a grocery store and made an aperitivo picnic up there both night (the view and the sunset were wonderful).

Reviews.Title: “Lots to love, but....”
Reviews.Author: TexasClaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights while exploring Rome for the first time, paid 165 euros per night for a double room. The hotel is very modern; bedrooms are small, as European ones tend to be, but the bathroom was enormous. Breakfast was lavish, served in a lovely room overlooking a garden. The front desk staff is very helpful, there is a computer w/ free internet access for guests. The roof bar was not open, but we went up several times just to enjoy the view. However, the location is noisy, much more so than we expected.. We moved from a room on the front to one on the back after the second night, but it didn't help much. While the hotel is on what appears to be a side street, it is in fact a shortcut to the Viale Trastevere, & gets heavy traffic. Also, the neighborhood is on the south end of Trastevere, making it inconvenient to come back from the center of Rome during the day to change clothes, have a short nap, etc. If we return to Rome, we'd probably look at staying in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Area... Soulless Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: fatboyg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights following Easter weekend. Prior to booking I was aware that it was part of an old convent, I did not realise it was still connected to one, and a church. It is without a doubt the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. (Im not a young reveller, Im a fifty something away for a break with my wife.) There is no atmosphere in this hotel at all. The rooftop bar and garden- which was heavily advertised as a selling point- was dirty and bare and unopen to the public, as they claimed it was not in season yet. I had to wonder when they consider start of season, seeing as the week prior was the busiest weekend in Romes calendar. The dining room was very nice but the food mediocre. The rooms however were immaculately clean which impressed my wife considerably. The location of the hotel is second to none for bars and restaurants and not too far to walk to the main tourist attractions. I doubt I would return to this hotel again, I like my accommodation to be more vibrant, less vocation.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to come back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Renske
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. The staff makes you feel very welcome. The rooms are tidy, bathrooms are fine. We had a nice room at the backside of the hotel overlooking the garden of the monestry. We woke up with the birds singing and the sun shining! The breakfast is great Fresh fruit, eggs, bread and all sorts of little typical Italian sweets. Although there is no service on the roofterrace yet (depending on the weather it will probably me late March or April), the weather was so nice that we brought some beers and enjoyed the beautiful views. It must me great to sit up there when the evenings are a bit warmer and the roofbar is open. It's definitely a plus when you are searching for a hotel in rome! After a day of walking relaxing in the sun, or a lovely after dinner drink. O, and then we must give a tip of what we found to be the best restaurant in Trastevere: Hostaria Glass, Vicolo del Cinque, 58 (near the Chiesa Santa Maria): great dishes, good balance in price and quality, lovely wines, nice staff, beautiful degin interior!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAT2222
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel. The rooms are small and the walls are thin! The staff and the breakfast were both very good and the location is also good. However, I think I would stay somewhere different next time. The price was reasonable for Rome and if you sleep heavily you should have no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linesandlines
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Clean, modern yet comfortable and with very helpful and charming staff. You know you've chosen well as soon as you walk in. The room was a little snug, but not too small, and the bathroom was spacious. Decor was attractive and comfortable in the rooms, and very airy, light and attractive throughout the common parts of the hotel. The breakfast area and rooftop bars are particularly nice - great places to spend some time. Our daughter was a small baby when we stayed here, and the staff were incredibly helpful and accommodating to her needs; brining boiled water to make milk, breadsticks for her to chew on etc. The location is good for an authentic Roman scene, although some way from the historical tourist hotspots. The price is fair - more than other hotels, but then you get nicer surroundings, and it makes no claims to be a luxury hotel. If you stay more than a few days the bill at check out may sting a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: argento1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The room was a little small but the bathroom made up for it. It was pretty hot and we had to keep the windows open at night to get cool and we got tons of mosquito bites. Oh well, that happens on vacation! There were tons of choices at breakfast and the dining area was so peaceful I almost felt like I was at a spa! The location was a little far out but once we mastered the bus routes it wasn't bad at all! Some of the front desk staff was helpful and some not so much. I know Rome can be expensive but I didn't feel that this hotel was 215 euros a night. However, we still had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: dedegirrl
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Italy and Hotel San Francesco was a great place to start out our trip! We were greeted warmly when arriving to the hotel and we were surprised at such a cute room! The room is not that big (using US standards) but it exactly what you need. The bathroom however was pretty spacious. The breakfasts were awesome and the breakfast room was so pretty and welcoming in the morning. The hotel is in the Trastevere neighborhood which has some great places to eat and explore and is easy to get to by bus once you figure out the bus routes. I would definately come back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who is coming to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AhVienna
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Hotel San Francesco. The staff are very helpful and breakfast is good . The roof terrace on a sunny day is lovely. Although the rooms are quite small the location of the hotel is great. Trastavere has great selection of reasonably priced restaurants and is within walking distance of the famous sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, attractive, clean”
Reviews.Author: CarolNormany
Reviews.Content: A group of six travelled together in Italy for two weeksand Hotel San Fransesco was our favourite. The location is very good for walking to a neat eating area of Trastavere (about 10 minutes). The hotel is very attractive with modern, comfortable decor. The lobby is beautiful and inviting. The clerks at the front desk were extremely helpful. The breakfast area was bright and the food and service were great. The rooms were a good size, very clean, quiet and nicely decorated. The bathroom was spotless. Our view was beautiful. The rooftop terrace was the highlight of our stay - great view, very attractive and a nice bar. Overall this was a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Was pleased for the money; has good and less good aspects”
Reviews.Author: sybil
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel isn't cheap (we had a room for 215 euros), it wasn't pricey by Rome standards. The daytime receptionist was extraordinarily helpful, making reservations and getting taxis for us, providing directions, etc. The room is basic, small and fine if you don't need a lot of luggage room. Bathroom, too, is okay. The tv table and TV are a bit shabby. Reception is stilted, but you do get CNN. The location is a bit out of the way in Trastevere, about a 5-7 minute walk from the restaurants and street life, right across the bridge from Testaccio. The breakfast is generous and sensational. Internet is available gratis at all times. I thought it was fine for the money as I'm in each hotel for about 20 waking moments. Mattresses are comfortable. I was in two different rooms, one facing a police station that's in the process of being renovated, the other facing the other side. The rooms were almost identical. A sweet touch was the bowl of cherry tomatoes at the reception desk and newspapers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop made up for the room”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get. Unfortunately, it's not the room that you pay for. This was a pricier hotel, and the rooftop bar at night was spectacular, as was the enormous breakfast buffet in the morning. The front desk was beyond helpful, and the lobby was very chic with its blue tones and art deco decor. There was also easy internet access available to guests in the lobby - a plus for us. The room, however, was very small compared to the other hotels we stayed in. Also, the room key was attached to a very heavy paperweight that felt like we were carrying around a cement block. In order to turn on any lights in your room, you had to plug your key into the wall - no joke. The decor was shabby, a shock since the rest of the hotel was so nice. We wondered if perhaps we got the one bad room in the hotel. We're still in disbelief that such a beautiful place would have such motor-lodge accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: Wardsabroad
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here - out of the hubub but close enough to walk everywhere we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Cozy and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: nangela
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July during very hot weather and the welcome home of the World Champion Italian Soccer Team. Our stay was wonderful because the staff was friendly, helpful, and always willing to give advice and directions. They recommended a small trattoria across the piazza, which was fantastic. I agree with other reviewers, the rooms are a little small and dark, but the bathrooms make up for it --totally bright, luxurious and well-appointed. The breakfast was plentiful and good. I would recommend this hotel. The location in Trastevere was really nice, close to everything, yet, you get a slice of Roman life in a different way. I've been to Rome many times, usually staying by the Spanish Steps. This was a welcome change.

Reviews.Title: “Girly mini break”
Reviews.Author: louandlily1972
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, clean and neat. Bellini's on the roof terace at the end of a long hot day are perfect. Rooms are clean and well eqipped as are the bathrooms. Would recommend for singles and couples, defintiely not suitable for small children.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: telli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Francesco for 6 nights in June. We found the staff at the hotel to be very helpful, particularly the older gentleman who worked the days who went out of his way to help us. The hotel is very clean and our room was what we expected from a Rome hotel however the bathroom was larger then we anticipated. The roof bar was a great place to relax and look over Rome however their prices were a little steep so we only drank their twice - cocktails were fine at 7E but they charged the same for a glass of wine?? The breakfast buffet was a great start to the day and we loved sitting in the breakfast room overlooking the garden planning our day. The location suited us fine as we enjoyed the walk into the centre of Rome however it is a little out of the city. We loved coming back into Trastevere at the end of the day however and picking where to eat from the many restaurants around the hotel. There is also a grocery store across the road which we found handy. For the price (175E) it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we learned about possible accommodations through our daughter's university in Rome. We intended to stay in Rome with a mid-stay, two-day visit to Florence. It was important that the hotel be cost-efficient and well-situated to both our daughter's place in the Janiculum and to the major sites in central Rome. We could not have been more fortunate in staying at the Hotel San Francesco! The staff was very helpful from the first e-mail contact as we weighed different time frames for our visit and most helpful in suggesting possible ways to see those areas, in Rome and outside the city, that we wanted to see. Every interaction we had with the Hotel's staff was positive, friendly and professional. Breakfasts were particularly pleasant, not only because of the lovely setting and the marvelous selection of foods, but because of the friendly and welcoming demeanor of the staff. By the third day, we felt like house guests when they had noticed that we each drank two pots of coffee each morning! The front desk was staffed by people who were gracious and knowledgeable. As travelers, we tend to avoid tours and this means we need help with local transportation (bus stops, bus routes, etc) which the front desk was more than able to provide. On the morning of our trip to Pompeii, the person staffing the desk prepared coffee (much needed) and a light breakfast for us, much to our surprise and appreciation given the horribly early time. The rooms, while somewhat spartan, are well-equipped and the bathrooms are luxurious and very clean. The location was ideal for trips not only within Rome - because of the Hotel's proximity to major bus lines and the tram line - but also for the ease with which we could get to and from both the airport and the train station on these same public transportation lines. There are many restaurants and shops nearby, as well as points of interest to explore. While this review appears to be effusive, it is matched by the experience that awaits guests at this superior hotel. We hope to go back even as we recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: MrsCaptainHenry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel San Francesco for 4 nights during his 15-day R&R from Iraq. We both enjoyed Hotel San Francesco and its location in Trastevere (although as another reviewer pointed out, our taxi driver from the train station had no idea where the hotel was located). When we return to Rome, we would definitely stay across the river again to enjoy the neighborhood feel and the great restaurants. The hotel had positives and negatives (as do all hotels). We appreciated having free internet access to check our email from time to time. The breakfast room and the morning buffet were great, and our server, Rosa, remembered after the first day that I liked American coffee with milk and brought it the moment we entered the dining room. Rosa also served our drinks in the rooftop bar, which was a lovely place for an afternoon cocktail after sightseeing. Our room was small, but perfectly fine and the bathroom spacious and sunny. The lobby is decorated in an eclectic style and is very nice for reading the newspaper or just meeting other guests. The desk staff was very nice, but not overly helpful. Those who spoke English did a great job. Would definitely return to the Hotel San Francesco!

Reviews.Title: “San Francesco is both stylish and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Always found a warm reception and pleasant smiling staff at San Francesco in the fascinating Trastevere district, where local restaurants, shops and hairdressers were also eager to provide excellent service. Made us so welcome during a long weekend in Rome. Twin room was on the small side but the large bathroom made up for this. everyone was so kind and helpful at the hotel. There is a real attention to detail in San Francesco, from the regular bedroom checks and towel changes to the well stocked and fresh breakfast buffet each day. The hotel is small but quite stylish and spotlessly clean, and, if April weather had been drier, we would have been happy to relax on the peaceful roof terrace. A lucky find! Really enjoyed the visit and will certainly come again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: amp1234
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great free breakfast, stay here! The spread is amazing and the breakfast room is quite nice. The rooftop view is also great and the rooftop bar is probably cool, but it was closed during April when we stayed there. The room was a little dark and dreary, not much to speak of. The bathroom was small but clean. The shower was really a glass phone booth. But it had windows that opened out onto the street and gave a nice breeze. The service was very good and the area was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: jbomer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the San Francesco. I have no complaints, especially considering the very reasonable 165 EUR rate. Yes, the rooms are small, but the bathrooms are actually quite roomy. It is a boutique hotel. Generally that means smaller rooms. The hotel staff were all helpful and polite. The included breakfast was a nice way to fuel up for a day of walking. And you will be walking in Rome (regardless of where you stay). The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from the heart of Rome and about 25-30 from the Vatican. We walked everywhere and never felt the need to take a cab (except for one afternoon during a particularly strong downpour). I would stay in Trastevere over any other area of Rome. It is still very close to most of the main sites and it is such a more peaceful environment. Tons of restaurants and bars. Narrow, winding streets with nearly non-existent car traffic. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyiob
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in Rome from the 1st Feb to the 4th. The hotel is not central but everything worth seeing is only about 1/2 hour walk at most. The graffiti was a bit of a shocker around the hotel, and the surrounding areas, but you seemed to get used to it and felt perfectly safe in the small streets surrounding the hotel. There were loads of restaurants to choose from, without actually eating in central Rome, and the prices were very reasonable. The Breakfasts were great at the hotel, fruit, eggs, bread etc. The room was a little on the small size, but to be honest, for the price we paid it was absolutely fine. However, if you get an opportunity, ask for a room away from the front of the hotel as it got quite noisy. We were given maps on arrival, which was just as well as our taxi driver had absolutely no idea where the hotel was and took us on a mystery ride!! Lukily we had agreed a price beforehand. I would recommend that you get the bus from the airport to the termini station this only cost us about £10.00 each return! We then got a taxi to the hotel which cost about £10.00. I would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on 1/4/06 for a three night stay. My boyfriend had become terribly ill on the flight to Paris. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful, and directed me to a pharmacy to get mediciation. He also helped translate the directions once I brought back the medicine. The breakfast was great, and they even allowed me to bring a tray up to the room for my sick boyfriend. Everytime we had a question about locations and food recommendations, we were provided with thorough directions. They had great recommendations for pizza in Trastavere - Ivo...yum! Our room was very comfortable and clean. My favorite part was the bathroom, with a big tub and a towel warmer! The bed was comfortable, and the ambient temperature was fine as well. I definitely felt that the service and amenities exceeded a 3 star rating. My only complaint was that we could hear some outside noise in our room from what sounded like a train crossing. Also, they used a rather toxic smelling cleaning material in our room. Airing it out for a few minutes cleared up the smell, but it was unpleasant. We booked our room at a rate of 135E, and were more than satisfied with the accomodations. I would easily recommend this hotel to others, and hope to stay again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Catherine10
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this hotel in October and had a wonderful time overall. It is a small hotel and travellers shouldn't expect all the amenities and services of a larger one. Our room was quite small and rather dark, although I understand from the website that other rooms are decorated differently. The bathroom was spacious and clean but storage space in the unit was at a premium. The staff were friendly and helpful but missed our early morning wakeup call. Bring your own alarm clock! Breakfasts were of excellent quality. We visited the rooftop bar for photos, but found the prices to be a bit high, especially when compared to neighbouring restaurants. There was a problem with the internet connection when we were there, but I don't believe it's the fault of the hotel management. There are now very stringent rules in Italy about internet access. We used the internet at a laundromat near the hotel but were required to present a passport to do so. We loved the location and walked everywhere - the coliseum, Spanish steps, and the Vatican. Because of the maze of streets and numerous bridges, there are many possible routes to each of the major tourist sites. Our first visit to the Vatican required 45 minutes (at a run), but for our second visit we walked along the Tiber and reduced it to no more than 25 minutes. The neighbourhood is fascinating and dining is much more reasonable than in the more 'touristy' areas. Poor quality pizza was 65 Euros on the Piazza Navona -full meals in Trastavere were available at half the price and gave us a chance to enjoy dining amidst large, local Italian families. The neighbourhood felt quite safe and we didn't hesitate to explore late in the evenings. Traffic in the square outside the hotel was a bit challenging to navigate, but noise wasn't a problem, even with a room street-side. Be sure to visit Santa Cecilia, a church about four blocks from the hotel with excavations of ancient Roman streets and a beautiful chapel decorated completely in mosaics.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location away from it all”
Reviews.Author: Tom&Terry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Francesco from December 26th through January 1, 2005. While the rooms are indeed small, they are well appointed and our bathroom was huge. Ask for a room overlooking the central courtyard. The hotel is in a lovely neighborhood just a bit off the beaten path but close enough to walk everywhere. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at San Fran for the past 2 years running, staff really helpful when directing you around Rome, the big dude at reception desk - could not do enough for us. Very clean, great Breafast but no restuarant or snacks available - plenty in the area though and with real Romans dining out. Area was cool, city centre within walking distance - happy days December the time to go no mass of tourists - stroll in the streets, bit of shopping, do as the romans do. have a great stay - great city!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast-but--”
Reviews.Author: rosieglow
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel,which from the write up seemed ideal. I arrived with my daughter about 10pm,after a delayed flight.The welcome was cool,and we were left to transport our luggage to our rooms. We would have welcomed the offer of a snack,maybe we should have asked,maybe they should have offered. Our room was well past its sell by date and cramped.The walls were paper thin, we could hear ordinary conversations in the next room. The bathroom looked clean,but smelt of damp,and we were unable to get in our room after breakfast as cleaning was already underway!! The advertised roof bar was closed,as was the bar in the foyer and the internet access point was out of order. On a more positive note,the breakfast room was very pleasant and he table well stocked. I would not stay there again,nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in December and had 2 rooms, one for me and my wife and one for our 2 sons. Chose the hotel from the previous reviews on this site and they were all very accurate and I would definately recommend staying here. This is not a large hotel and it is situated away from the bustle of the city centre. Its a perfect retreat after a busy day sightseeing. The rooms are very cosy, clean and pleasant, quite small but with large bathrooms. Our sons room had a huge shower. The front rooms overlook the road and can be a bit noisy but didn't stop 2 teenagers from sleeping ! Our room was at the rear of the hotel and was much quieter and overlooked the monastery gardens. This is a lovely and peaceful view and is a real oasis ! The breakfast area is the same, looking into the gardens full of fruit trees. Breakfast is 1st class. The staff are friendly, helpful, speak good english and provided us with good maps and arranged taxis to and from the airport(Ciampino is about 30 minutes drive ). Trastevere is a very old part of Rome which we probably wouldn't have seen had we stayed in the centre. It is a wonderfull experience walking through the little narrow streets full of traditional pizzarias and restaurants. You must walk through these little streets to the Vatican, about 30 minutes but you see so much more. In fact we walked everywhere from the hotel, its tiring and you need to be reasonably fit but at a stroll we reached the Forum and Collosseum in about 20 minutes ( use the maps to cut through the side streets)and the Trevi Fountain in about 25 minutes. So, very pleased with the choice of hotel, location and of course one of the best city's in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal location”
Reviews.Author: lucababy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in October. I cannot praise the hotel or location highly enough! The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful, the rooms are small, but tastefully decorated, as is the rest of the hotel. We only managed breakfast once, and it was ok, although, the bacon and eggs were all gone by 9am! The location though is what made it for us. There was great public transport a minutes walk from the hotel in the form of buses and trams. Then at night, the best area in Rome,(in our opinion), for bars and restaurants, was a 2 minute walk from our hotel.Trastevere is a wonderful, romantic magical place, especially at night, but very easy to get lost in! We loved every minute of our stay, even if it did rain most days, we wouldn't change a thing, and if we are lucky enough to return, we will definately stay at the San Francesco hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Hotel San Francesco between 1st and 6th of December with our 1-year-old baby (sorry about the inconveniences to our neighbours :-). The service was excellent, the breakfast was really great. Everybody was nice and helpful. Most tourist attractions were reachable on foot (depending on how much you like to walk) in a maximum of 30-40 minutes. The room was small but clean, and it had a large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels that we stayed at in our entire time in Italy. We were in Italy for 3 weeks and spent 5 days at this hotel. The service is great, the decor is fabulous, the staff is absolutely wonderful and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel-Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights while stopping in Rome. The hotel is clean and in very nice shape, was a little disapointed that it was so far away from the train station and the street is not on the two rome maps that we bought and no one really seemed to know exactly where the street was to get to the hotel? Do not take a taxi from the train station to this hotel, have the hotel hire someone for you or take the "H" bus to that area of rome and walk. Rome is very spread out and we walked everywhere, saw everything but spent all day walking (15 miles). Definitly check out the roof deck and there are a couple of very cool "mom&pop" restaurants around that area and the people were so very nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel – great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: The San Francesco is definitely worth a visit. The best and what makes this hotel special, is the breakfast and the breakfast room. The room is so charming. The chairs are comfortable, the breakfast has lots of choices including lots of fresh fruit cut into small pieces, bacon and eggs, cakes, yogurt, ham, cheese, juice, prunes, etc etc. But this is not even the best part; the best part is the big windows facing the garden of the monastery where the monks are walking around tending their garden. The rooms are nice, not very big, but hey it is only a three star hotel, so this is what to expect, the bathroom is big though. I don’t think that the mini bar is being used very much. After seeing that one of the cokes had an expiration date in august, we decided to go to the Standa (supermarket) 100 yards from the hotel) and buy my own drinks. The staffs are nice and always willing to help with recommendation of restaurants and how to get to the sights. There is a roof terrace with bar, we loved to sit there watching the sun set, and the top of the saint Peters Church. The hotel is close to most of the sights: Santa Maria In Trastevere 5 min on foot Piazza Navona and Pantheon 15 min on foot Saint Peter 20 min on foot Circus Massino 15 on foot And there are so many very good restaurants right next to the hotel The only thing I could complain about is that the internet was broken, and stayed broken all week.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly clean and casual”
Reviews.Author: SNDP
Reviews.Content: Personal recommendations and heavy rotation on TARF prompted us to book this hotel for our trip (we have just returned from a weeklong, and it only rained substantially on Thu and Fri) as the Daphne Inns were both fully booked despite our seeking bookings as far back as July. Poor first impressions! Despite confirmation emails from Daniele (the proprietor whom we never saw) as recent as four (4) and two (2) days before arrival, no hire cab was found waiting for us and we rang the hotel after thirty (30) minutes to note there was no record of a confirmation. That was a sour note to start upon. A taxicab ride was not too cumbersome but the street address is a mini alley: you are better served asking the cabbie to go to Trastevere at Piazza San Francesco di Ripa (or cross streets: Via Trastevere and Via G. Induno). Even on the Thomas Guide equivalent in the cab, it was hard to find the little street. Our cabbie Giuseppe was most gracious. Note that there are higher rates for travel between 2200 and 0700. Warm welcome: The lobby is welcoming with an elegant glass door behind security bars. Our concierges were competent and friendly (Marina, Benedetto) but the night concierge (Alessandro) is an absolute gem: the day we had o Eurostar to Firenze, he made us an elegant cappuccino at 0600 and you know what they say about a man who makes you a coffee drink in the morning time :) The maps issued by the hotel are wonderfully detailed and we filled every cargo pant pocket with them. You can walk anywhere as it is not more than 30 minutes away. We never took the trolley, tram or bus but they had very lovely suggestive ads on them. The high street, Via Trastevere, is literally a stone's throw from the hotel and there are at least three (3) GS (general stores) within a minute's walk. We walk briskly while in Roma. Concierges were competent in suggesting travel times and routes, and booking cabs and restaurants. We never needed advance booking for meals, and were always welcomed warmly. There are only 24 rooms and the clientele is mixed (Americans, Scots, English, German and Dutch), and older. No cruiseheads or students in this unit. Amenities abound - Brunch and service (tax) is included in the cost of the room. This past week the cost was E195 but I noticed some rooms getting a discounted rate of E165. Your mileage may vary. If you pay cash upfront (and in advance) you can get 10% off - ask for the offer. We were just not comfortable withdrawing that much in advance. The Bancomat (cash machine) is just around the corner. The neighborhood is safe to walk around at both 0600 and 0200. You always see carabinieri around Roma so security is not a cause for worry. The first night we returned, we simply asked for our keys by room number and were given them - puzzling without security identification. Since they had examined our passports upon entry, it is assumed, we had our images scanned but I do not know. Brunch is served daily 0700-1000 in a sunroom with a view of the cloister. It was not clear whether or not it was served on Sunday as Marina was not clear on this matter - it might have been a language barrier. The spread is adequate with the distressing use of canned fruits and the same CD (except on the weekend, when they switched to Lionel Richie's best: exercise caution when you wish for it). The bread was exquisite and the coffee brisk. Cheeses were repeated daily. The pastries were fine. It was certainly value for money. Room with a view - The rooms are small and European with hard carpeting. I am not sure the cooling units worked, and thus slept with both room and toilet windows open. While not noisy, it does permit tiny gnat like creatures to enter the room. My friend was stung by a little creature in the adjacent room, resulting in a little swelling with no superimposed infection to follow; she had slept with the windows shut. There are two small dorm room size nightstands with good lighting, a small desk you cannot possibly write upon (its width is size limiting), a double bed (European sized and thus short) with clean linen and adequate pillows, an armoire that holds approximately a dozen clothes hangars (half for full length items), a few shelves and a self-explanatory digital safe, and a stocked refrigerator we never used. The bathroom has non textured grouted tiled floors (skid alert), faux painting, porcelain fixtures (my hot and cold faucets were reverse labeled but indeed working well) including a stand up tray shower with flexible shower handle (with below average shower head pressure, and below average thermal mixing), a sparkling water closet and bidet. The sink is wide with counter room. ALl drainage was adequate. Face towels are thin and not absorbent. Bath towels are plush and served well. Toiletries could have been better but we stocked up from the GS nearby. Security - Instead of keycards, there are heavy filled cowbells with a key and a plug like device attached to them. At the base of the bell (not hollow) is an imprint of your room number. The plug needs to enter any of the black sockets in your room to switch the lights on. It is not an electricity activator as explained incorrectly by Marina as the telly will still need to be shut off. The brunch staff always checks the hotel room number by momentarily inverting the cowbell, but you see no extra charge for the coffee. We fail to grasp the significance of this action. Extras - Rooms were immaculate, bathrooms were clean, linen was straighted out (but top sheets were not necessarily always replaced). Dustbins are tiny so accumulated trash on the floor does not get collected. My wake up call was the 0700 pealing of the SF de Ripa church bells (with a snooze pealing at 0715). There were many gulls making a racket in the morning on the cranes posited nearby and the construction pretty much defeated any chance of a romantic rooftop evening. There is a reasonable amount of neighborhood construction in progress but we never heard it at night (we were not in the hotel during waking hours). The rooftop bar has retro chic (meaning lovely to look at but terribly inconvenient) sitting furniture and a standard cocktail menu; there were too many bistros, bars, pizzerias, osterias ecc. in the neighborhood to tempt us away so we never really used the service upstairs. As the crane obstructed the view, it was dissonant to having any drinks in quiet ripose. Leaving on a jet plane - On our final morning after a cracking brunch (we expected no less), Alessandro had our confirmed private hirecar ready to take us to Fiumicino on schedule. I should like to recommend the hotel on the basis of its location, cleanliness, quiet at night, access to attractions, included brunch and value for money (in that order). I would be absolutely ready wtih 50 euros to take a cab to the hotel (look for a white taxicab with the words TAXI on the top) just outside the Greeting area after baggage claim, negotiate a fixed rate and get to the hotel. The inconvenience of waiting for a cab and then not having one ready makes for a start that does not augur well and the hotel staff should be aware of the importance of first impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SA Rose 41
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Rome at the San Francesco Hotel. The breakfast is quite nice with a large selection. We enjoyed the rooftop bar two of the evenings. The staff was very helpful in helping us to arrange a tour, a private tour, and the taxi to the airport. The private driver they arranged was wonderful and helped us to see more of Rome in our limited time. Additionally, they suggested restuarants for us. I was disappointed that our room was on the street side and had quite a bit of noise. The bathroom was nice, but the room was relatively smallish.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL, but good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francesco was in great walking distance from everything. The Pantheon is about a mile, Making the North end of the city tourist area about a 2-2.5 mile walk. But there is plenty to entertain as you walk along. Also of great benefit were the laundromat nearby, the standa supermarket a block away, and the numerous restaurants (some even cheap!) There were many choices of restaurants in the area. Of particular interest to me (since I'm cheap and the US dollar is weak) was Le Mani in Pasta (or something similar). We escaped from there with a first course, two seconds, water & at least two large beers for $30 euro - and our overeating American bellies were full! :) The breakfast at the hotel is very good, a lot of variety and plenty of food! There were a couple downsides: the king bed is two twins pushed together (& I inevitably woke up between the mattresses) and the shower requires a little coordination as the only shower head holder is low & you basically have to wash then rinse (unless there is a trick I don't know.) But, if you are looking for decorating ideas or thinking of doing your own custom windows, their's were really cool. When I'm rich, I'll be trying to duplicate those!

Reviews.Title: “we loved rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights on honeymoon at this charming hotel in the trastevere area of rome and we cant praise this hotel enough!! when it didnt rain the roof top bar was excellent! found all the main sites of rome easy enough using the public transport which stopped near the hotel,breakfast was excellent as was the coffee!! all in all rome is a marvellous place to go and hope to return one day! only downside to our visit was it raining for 2 days but you cant let the weather put you off, and also the americans,the most uncultured race on this planet! please stick to disneyland!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whooley
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel in early October. The hotel kindly booked a taxi to pick us up at the airport and the taxi man with his sign was there waiting when we arrived...a good start to our holiday! Yes, the rooms are small but very pleasant. The bathroom was lovely and even had large windows. There was no bath, just a shower. The room had been cleaned every day when we arrived back in the afternoon. The weather wasn't great so we only got to the roof terrace one evening at dusk and it was lovely. Must be fab in the summer. Breakfast was a lovely continental buffet in a very pleasant room and included juice, cereal, fruit, cheese, ham, yogurts, bread and lots of cakes! For us the location of the hotel could not be beaten. It is on the edge of Trastevere, and a five minute walk away is an abundance of fantastic authentic restaurants and bars on narrow, windey, cobblestone streets. We didn't have one bad meal nor were we 'ripped off' once in Rome. All the main sights are about 20/30 mins walk away. No matter where we ended up in Rome there was a bus or tram home in the evening. Exploring Trastevere was in the evenings was one of the highlights of our holiday. The staff were always pleasant and helpful and spoke good English. Booked us a restaurant and our taxi to take us back to the airport.......

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending 5 nights in Rome at the San Francesco Hotel, found it perfect in terms of location and ambience. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and made us feel welcome. If we return to Rome, we would have no hesitation in returning to the San Francesco. Within easy walking distance of the major sights.and shopping. There is also an excellent tram service within 200 metres of the hotel. Buffet breakfast was something to look forward to, as was an evening visit to the roof top bar. Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
