Reviews.Content: We just stayed for one night at the end of our honeymoon this month. Both of us regretted that we hadn't planned more time in Rome. Trastavere is a great location. It is trendy in a very international way. People from all over the world live, work, and play in this neighborhood. It is primarily young and somewhat "artsy". There are tons of restaurants nearby and it is easy to get to the sights of Rome. They have a charming roof top deck with a great view. It would be hard to find if you haven't been there. Coincidentally my husband had stayed there years before. He didn't remember where he stayed until he saw the address of the place I had booked. He liked the hotel just as much then as now. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Trastevere Gem”
Reviews.Author: slimKent_England
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francesco, located close to the River Tiber, in the region of Trastevere in what I would describe as the heart of Rome's peaceful yet, lively cultural centre, and everything within walking distance. Hotel San Francesco, delivers a high standard of service and comfort, in a relaxing environment, decorated and fitted to high standards for the discerning tourist seeking good quality and comfort. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendy at all times, never short of helping and making you feel at ease. Any special requests - don't mention it, you won't be let down. Once entering Hotel San Francesco, you will find a bright open plan reception area, classically designed, and spacious, through to individual rooms that are well thought out. Breakfast is a must, offering a wide variety of Continental delicacy to start your day. Whether a short or long stay in Rome, check this hotel..........I was more than satisfied as this was a first trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7mlf
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my first trip to Italy with the first 2 nights in Rome at the Hotel San Francesco. This is very much a boutique hotel--filled with many artistic touches throughout the building. The rooftop terrace is very cool, and yes(as noted in a previous review) the wine is kind of expensive and the glasses were not as full as I wished. But the atmosphere was first rate and I felt like it was worth the price (and you didn't have to buy anything to enjoy the view either.) As for the room, it really is very small--maybe about 11' square. The bathroom made the room manageable as it was very light, pleasant and actually on the big side. But I did feel a bit cramped and it was difficult living out of a suitcase in such a small space. Of course, this is not all that important when you spend most of your time out of the room anyway. We enjoyed Trastevere and found it easy enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go--the Vatican, and all the historical sites across the river. After a long day of sightseeing, it was nice to be able to walk just 3-4 blocks to reasonably priced, authentic restaurants. We found the staff to be helpful and efficient. The breakfast buffet included some hot items as well as the more typical breads, cakes, and fruit and in the end was our favorite hotel breakfast menu. Overall, the Hotel San Francesco is an excellent value and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Joannecam
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our week long stay at the Hotel San Francesco in Trastevere. The room was small, but it was also quiet and relatively inexpensive by Roman standards. The breakfast was wonderful and the rooftop bar was a lovely place to have a drink in the afternoon. Trastevere is a fun place to stay with numerous great restaurants just down the block. I was particularly impressed with the staff, especially Daniele who helped us with several difficulties before we even arrived. We would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 6 nights at Hotel San Francesco very much. There are many quaint little restaurants within walking distance, and it was easy to access public transportation to get to anywhere we wanted to go in Rome. Our room was very comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless and quite large. All the staff (front desk, breakfast servers, etc.) were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, and the breakfast room looked out onto a pleasant little courtyard. The rooftop bar was a great place to relax and have a drink and watch the sunset at the end of a busy day of sightseeing. The free internet access made it easy for us to keep in touch with family back home. All in all, our first visit to Rome was wonderful and having the Hotel San Francesco as our "home away from home" made it even more pleasant. Grazie to everyone at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, ideal location in lovely Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in a quiet square off the Viale Trastevere, the only sound was the chiming of the local church bell. Room was small but perfectly adequate and very clean, nice large bathroom. Breakfast was lovely, great choice of fruits, yoghurt, cereals, bread, ham, cheese, cakes, pastries and even bacon and eggs in the hot cabinet. We walked to all of the main sites and loved being so close to the river and its bridges and little markets. Loved coming back at night to sample yet another authentic and reasonable Trastevere restaurant with nice friendly staff and good service. So glad we were not staying in a big anonymous hotel in a busy, noisy area. Very relaxing to come back and sit in the cool lobby with a coffee at the end of a hard day's sight-seeing. Only gripe - lovely roof terrace with fantastic views which we would have visited every night except for the measly (couple of mouthfuls) of not very good wine that we paid 6 Euros a glass for (average price of good bottle of wine was 14 Euros in restaurants). Smallest, most expensive glass of wine I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 3 days and it was a really good choice. Location was great and not to far out as previous reviews said. transport in Rome is really easy to get around on. We walked most places, despite the heat, with the help of the hotel map. We saw a lot of the areas we had considered staying in and I am really glad we chose this area. Trastavere is great for eating and just strolling around and the san francesco is really quite but near to the restaurants etc. The hotel is cool and clean and our rooms were really quite. The roof top was lovely, we went there every evening to have a drink before going out to eat. I would definately stay here again if visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Retreat in Fast Paced Rome”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the San Francesco from August 2-6,2005. The hotel is modern and comfortable, while maintaining that intimate boutique hotel feel. Both the double and the triple rooms were nicely decorated, had great showers, and air conditioning that really worked. The breakfast room was lovely and the breakfast buffet included more options than anyplace else we stayed in Italy. The staff were very helpful in arranging airport transportation (five people, 6 huge suitcases at 4:45am on a Saturday was not easy) and accommodating any other requests we had. It's a bit of a walk to the major sights, anywhere from 20-40 minutes, but we absolutely enjoyed it and when it got too much for our moms, we jumped in a cab which usually cost us 5 - 10 Euro from wherever we happened to be. Rome is a busy place that can overwhelm, so coming home to a quiet hotel in Trastevere at the end of the day was a welcome treat. It is THE area for cute outdoor cafes, in fact, tour companies bring bus loads of people to Trastevere to enjoy dinner in "authentic Rome" every evening. How lucky for us that we lived in the neighborhood and could walk to any of the restaurants each and every evening. The rooftop bar was a nice treat. We went up there one evening at about 10pm and had the entire candle lit rooftop to ourselves. Most evenings after dinner my son and husband would play a game of chess in the lobby while I read the newspaper. As most European hotels don't have balconies, it's nice to have a common area such as a lobby or rooftop bar. Sometimes you just want to relax at your hotel, but you don't necessarily want to be stuck in your room. The hotel has a huge guestbook and it's clear from the comments of previous visitors, that many people have enjoyed the San Francesco as much as we did. Highly recommended. Globetrotter Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 28th July for 3 nights and what a great time we had. The welcome was warm, the room was cool and the roof top bar gave us a view that made us smile. We even stayed in touch with our kids via e-mail using the free internet use in the lobby! We walked to the Vatican and all the attractions, but were pleased to be away from it all on a night time to enjoy the local hospitality. Try the trattoria just to the right as you come out of the hotel, the food was fabulous. Around the corner was the piazza merchant, well worth a visit for food with a bit of entertainment. Cant actually fault anything about our stay in the San Francesco and could write loads about the merits of Rome and its people. If you are thinking of staying here, then just do it, it was lovely, and we will be back. Thanks to all in the San Francesco.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on recommendations from this website and were slightly disppointed as we were expecting something fantastic. The hotel is good but not as great as some people made out. However, this was our first stay in Rome and we would come back to this hotel. The room and hotel were very clean but no-one mentioned you can hear pretty much everything from the bathrooms in the adjoining rooms. The air conditioning was a god send and the safe and mini ironing board were nice additions. Our only complaint is with one of the receptionists. Before arriving my wife had emailed the hotel to arrange a secret bottle of champagne and cake on the rooftop bar to celebrate my 30th birthday. On our first day as we were walking out the entrance to explore the area the mentioned receptionist called me back to the desk and said to me 'would you like your champagne now'. The surprise totally spoilt, my wife said 'No thankyou, it was supposed to be a surprise'. Also, on our last day the same receptionist failed to arrange a wake-up call and airport taxi that I had requested the previous night. However, the manager did send us a very nice apologetic letter to say sorry for the champagne incident and gave us a complimentary bottle of red wine. The letter and gesture was so nice we did feel a bit guilty about moaning about the hotel between ourselves. The rooftop terrace is very nice but as someone has mentioned before we did get some uncultured yanks coming up with pizza and beer!

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OperaFan
Reviews.Content: With the dizzying number of hotel choices in Rome, I had a difficult time deciding on THE place to stay for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. My husband kept thanking me for choosing San Francesco. It is nicely furnished and clean, with a friendly and hardworking staff, and has a peaceful atmosphere that is highly uncharacteristic for one of the busiest and noisiest cities in the world. On my previous trip to Rome, I stayed within the tourist district (Via Nazionale) - what a difference! Our corner room was small - but it has a high ceiling, a good size closet, in-room safe, enough room to walk around, and the bathroom is incredibly spacious. We didn't really spend that much time in our room except to sleep and to refresh in-between visiting sites. The air conditioning was a blessing (!), the bed comfortable, and the water hot or cold when you want it. We liked to walk, so walked almost everywhere in spite of the July heat. As the focus of our trip was Ancient Rome, we were in a good position to walk to the Forum, the Colosseum, and Campo de' Fiori. On the day we visited Vatican City, we had the hotel call us a taxi to reserve energy for waiting in the ticket line. Don't be discouraged by the line going along the wall back towards the square - it moves very fast. We arrived around 11:15 and got in by 12:30. We dined in Trastevere in the cool evenings - there were so many (reasonably priced) places to choose from! The Piazza Santa Maria is a 5 minute stroll, and the entire area is very much akin to Greenwich Village in NY - except older and, well, Italian! Hotel San Francesco allowed us to experience the real Rome and still enjoy a restful stay. Thank you for helping to make our visit a real positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: holidayprincess
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful long weekend in Rome, made especially good by staying at this charming hotel. Everything about it was perfect (and I confess I am a very fussy traveller!). We stayed in Room 106 which was a corner room with a gorgeous view over the peach trees into the convent courtyard. The bathroom is very modern and large with a beautiful cathedral style window and a tub with hand held and powerful shower. Also a big double bed and much appreciated aircon. We loved all the quirky and stylish touches round the hotel. As a previous reviewer has said, the roof terrace looks even better than the website photos, with oversized pots, rocks, flaming torches etc. A truly wonderful place to start or end your evening. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff including arranging airport transfers, and a bottle of wine to be left in the room for my husband's birthday. The original hotel we had chosen was full and they recommended San Francesco, we feel very lucky they did, and can't wait to go back! If you have any questions about this hotel, feel free to e-mail me debbiemcnicol@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Romin'Woman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Francesco lived up to its great reviews and was an overall excellent choice. Our room was small but the high ceilings and large bathroom compensated. The breakfast was delicious and served in a beautiful room and the staff was helpful. We also loved being in the Trastevere area.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel in a convenient spot”
Reviews.Author: Professor_Ken
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this cozy and comfortable hotel in May. The staff couldn't have been nicer and answered a multitude of questions. The breakfast buffet was also superb and we ended up spending twice as much time eating breakfast as we expected. The location is great for walking to many of the major attractions. The free Internet access off the lobby is also a nice touch. We appreciated the discount for paying with cash, although it took a little effort to find an open bank. Highly recommended as a base for exploring Rome.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: holidayfever
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after spending 5 nights in the Hotel San Francesco. Daniele the General Manager very kindly arranged for a taxi to meet us at the airport which made the journey so much more pleasant. Despite our plane being delayed 50 minutes the driver was waiting for us. The hotel was as others have written in previous reviews so I won't repeat them. After a long day siteseeing the hotel was a peaceful sanctuary to unwind and the rooftop bar was a welcome sight before we ate out in one of the many restaurants nearby. The staff in the hotel are all superb very efficent basically nothing is too much trouble for them. This hotel deserves more than it's 3* rating Thank you to everyone at the San Francesco for making our stay in Rome so wonderful and we will be recommending you to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in rome”
Reviews.Author: loudjazz45
Reviews.Content: the san francesco was the ideal spot for exploring rome, i passed most of the other hotels we had considered and silently praised the lord that we had chose the the right one; a tranquil setting, not overrun with crowds of tourists on your doorstep, a cool area for wandering around during the evening, some great restaurants and bars and staff with a 'can do ' attitude. Oh , the mindblowingley ginormous Porta Portese flea market is just around the corner for an intruiging sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RN6
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a great weekend in Rome, the hotel certainly contributed. As well as being clean and decorated in a modern boutique style, the staff were more than helpful. The rooms aren't large, but have great air conditioning and the bathrooms are big, with powerful showers. The breakfast was good and the roof top bar not to be missed. Superb value for money and a great base to explore the city from, with trams leading to all of the big attractions just two minutes walk up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish place does the job”
Reviews.Author: Stewart76
Reviews.Content: Some hotels look just like all the others inside, but this one does not. The decor, from the hall (free internet access) to the roof bar, is marvellous and someone has spent a lot of time and money sorting it out. The rooms are as described elsewhere on this site. The location is great, between church and monastery, handy for trams to town but only 10-15 mins walk from the river. In fact you can leg it to the Forum quite easily; in the other direction we walked to the Vatican for the early queue, or another day up the Janiculum hill for the views across the city. Zillions of restaurants within 10 mins walk, ranging from economy to €100 for two. Piazza S Maria in Trastevere is the spot for evening fun. Sore feet after a day sightseeing - jump on the number 8 tram back the the hotel. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes, there is air-conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: HDM
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three weeks in Italy and spent our first week at the San Francesco. There's no need for me to reiterate all the positive comments here. It's a charming hotel in an great area and the staff is warm and helpful. True, our room was small. This was only a problem because of the lack of closet space and it was a bit tight living out of a suitcase. I couldn't have packed any lighter (although my husband would disagree) because we had three weeks of travel ahead of us. We opted for a bathroom with a shower instead of a tub and it could easily have accommodated both of us. Yes, there were a couple of mouldy spots on the tile but it was basically a spotlessly clean hotel. My only concern here is that one of the reviews (June 2005) said that there wasn't air-conditioning but that's incorrect. We certainly had air-con in our room and a good thing, too, since we were in Rome during a hot spell. I'd hate to think that anyone would pass up this lovely hotel because they thought there was no air-conditioning! As we walked around Rome, everytime I passed a hotel that I had considered, I realized how lucky we were to have ended up in Trastevere! We often took the tram and occasionally even walked over one of the bridges to the historic centre. The few cab rides we took were short and inexpensive. Regarding the lack of closet space, my feeling is that when I travel I need to loosen up on a couple of things. If you just concentrate on the few negatives you miss so many of the positives!

Reviews.Title: “great non touristy neighborhood, easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: cattrav
Reviews.Content: After three days, we had to move to another hotel for a business conference, but we liked the Trastevere neighborhood so much we came back here for the final night of our stay. It is true, as others have noted, that the rooms are small. But there is an easy solution - pack light and use a laundry just a few doors north of the hotel. It was open every time we walked past - early in the morning, and late at night - and it also seemed to be an internet cafe and a station for making long distance phone calls. We did a load of laundry there about four days into the trip, with the help of the young man attending the place, who didn't speak English (we speak very little Italian). The cost was by weight for the wash and by time for the dry. It cost about $2 for one load of wash, about $3 to dry, and laundry detergent and fabric softener from the dispenser were relatively cheap - less than a euro for both. Although certain travelers might consider this a waste of time, others might find 90 minutes figuring out laundry in another language to be pretty fun. The hotel San Francesco is great for fast and easy-to-figure-out public transportation. Walk east across the river to catch the number 23 bus to the Vatican. Walk west about a block to Viale Trastevere to take the very frequent number 8 tram to Largo de Torre Argentina. From there, its a short block or two west to Campo de Fiori, north to Piazza Navona or the Pantheon, or east to Piazza Venezia and the Via del Corso. Or, hop on a number 63 bus here (at Largo de Torre Argentina) and you'll very quickly end up at the Via Veneto with a short walk to the Galleria Borghese and the beautiful park around it, which would be perfect for a picnic. One public transport warning; there is a different tram, the 3, which theoretically heads east to the Colosseo and beyond. We did take it to the Colosseo. But it was very infrequent and crowded - I wish we'd taken a taxi instead of ever waiting for it. The breakfast room at this hotel is lovely, with an occasional glimpse of the Franciscans walking through the courtyard. The gulls outside can be noisy at night, but we kind of liked them. We didn't use the rooftop bar until the last night, and then regretted not using it before. It had a wonderful breeze and soft music and an amazing view, and aside from the bartender, we were the only ones there to see the sunset. Regarding the previous review by the Bristol traveler, I can say that I am an American, and the other Americans I met in this hotel were charming, cheerful and full of useful advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with big bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: fishyflier
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a four night stay at the San Francesco. The rooms were small but immaculate. The bathroom was huge. It is a lovely hotel with a very friendly English speaking staff. Unfortunately, the weather was very hot and there was no air conditioning so we had no choice but to keep the windows open all night. Our room faced the street which was so noisy that we had trouble sleeping every night. I would suggest asking for a room facing the courtyard or bringing ear plugs!! Aside from that little glitch it was a great hotel in a great location - easy walking distance to the ancient sites. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel SF: Quiet refuge in Roma”
Reviews.Author: gatz
Reviews.Content: We eventually opted to stay in SF for 4 nights from the reviews seen here. It was an idyllic place as it was situated next to a quiet piazza. Picked up by airport transfer which was perfect as soon as you land from an 8 hour flight without the hassle of finding a cab or shuttle. Check-in was quick and easy. The breakfast was more than we needed and more. Rooms were very small and they do not have enough closets or drawers for clothes so don't pack too much. Bathroom was okay, had some blacken dirt on the black tiles but overall, roomy and they provided clean towels everyday. The best part was the rooftop, where I think everyone hangs out in the evenings for drinks before going out to dinner. Weather was especially perfect for it and Luciano was the nicest and most accomodating and unobtrusive bar tender in the whole of Rome. Trastevere is the nicest location especially at Piazza Santa Maria where all the locals hang out, it's fun and bustling but not too rowdy. They have some pretty neat bars around this area which is a very short walk along San Francesco Ripa. Easy accessibility to tram #8, to get through to all the bus connections to most of the sights via Arenula. A couple of suggestions: ask regarding day trips to other cities such as Venice, Naples, Capri and Pompei, worth the money if you're already there. Try Brunello red wines, a bit pricey but truly worth the extra bucks. The only problem was the front desk people were not very suggestive with the restaurants, as they probably don't live in the area. A great place to try is Ditirambo, in Piazza Cancelleria --- along Corso Vittorio Emanuel II near Piazza Navona, the most authentic and delicious restaurant we had. Overall, SF was a nice haven to go home to especially after all the walking and craziness of the Roman sights.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 3 night stay at the San Francesco in mid May. The directions from airport via train and tram were provided by the hotel and were so helpful. Our accomodations were great and the hotel staff were extremely helpful with answering questions, providing maps, information and giving excellent service. The buffet breakfast is the best! Staying in Trastevere really made our visit to Rome special. The ambience of the area with wonderful restaurants, shops and atmosphere gave us a neighborhood feel. The hotel is well located and quiet. A lovely view from the rooftop terrace. A real find for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We felt San Francesco was the perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: fwr
Reviews.Content: The intimate size, the very helpful and professional personnel, the fantastic breakfast, the modern architecture and decor housed in a period building, the marvelous roof deck, the convenient location, the competitive rates added up to a very satisfactory experience. We would go back in a minute. Bravo! My only complaint might be that the room was not quite as large as I would have liked, although it was the one I requested (thank you!) based on my reading of another review. It may be that they have rooms of various sizes and it might be worth a conversation with the person on duty for guidance in choosing a room. We had #306 which was on a quiet corner so the (large!) bathroom and it's (large!) window were on a different wall than the bedroom window making it all feel reasonably spacious. It's just that more maneuvering room in the bedroom would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: Am keying this now on the hotel's PC having just finished a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hotel San Francesco, excellent rooms although a little small with a large bathroom and shower, beds great and not too much noise from the incredibly noisy Roman traffic. Breakfasts great, location ideal in atmospheric Trastevere, great little bar nearby in Ripa called Cantina Grossa, gorgeous waitress who reminded me of cross between Gina Lollabrigida and Jessica Rabbit! Only criticism - an American family who bought their pizzas, melon and beer on to the roof terrace (and made a right mess) where the rest of us were trying to enjoy a civil cocktail in the evening - have you Americans no sense of class or style at all???

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Weekend_getaways
Reviews.Content: A group of friends booked 3 rooms at the San Francesco. Having read the reviews we were a little concerned about finding the hotel for the first time and so the day before I called the hotel and asked if he could arrange a taxi for 5 ( and 5 pieces of luggage ) from the airport. The manager explained that we would need a minibus to make sure we would all get in , and told us the price €65 - and checked if that was OK. When we arrived a charming ( English speaking ) driver was waiting at the airport for us with a sign with our name, with a van that was plenty big enough. We checked in early ( 11 a.m. ) and 2 of our 3 rooms were available immediately. The staff bent over backwards to be helpful and accommodating. They ordered lots of taxi's for us ( for 5 people each time - which are not always easy to find ). The roof top bar is only open from 5 until about 10 p.m., but they were happy for us to go up there ( and take coffees/drinks from the downstairs bar up with us ) at any other time ( We went up for coffees after our night out - the roof is lovely with views over Rome and is magical on a warm evening ). The Trastevere is a fantastic area of Rome to stay, with lots of charming restaurants and interesting small shops, yet it is still within easy reach of the main areas ( we walked back to the hotel from central Rome on 2 evenings ). The Trastevere is also a lot quieter than central Rome, and there is almost no noise from the street when you are in your room, and it was wonderful to come back to the quiet after the hustle and bustle of the main sites to recuperate and recharge before setting off again. The rooms were on the small side but were clean, with good bathrooms, and the breakfast was great ( although the eggs could have been better ). Rome is a fabulous city, and I will definitely be back, and when I am I will stay again at the San Francesco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kenan15
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful trip to Rome made better by our stay at the Hotel San Francesco in Trastevere. We decided on San Francesco based on its great reviews on tripadvisor, and were not disappointed. Having never been to Rome, we were a little concerned about its somewhat less central location. However, Trastevere was an easy walking distance to the Forum, the Colosseum, Piazza Navona, and Campo De' Fiori. We loved the character of the neighborhood, and the less touristy atmosphere. The hotel overlooks the church of S. Francesco a Ripa, which houses a gorgeous Bernini sculpture. The hotel itself is clean, bright, and well staffed. Our room was quite small, but efficient. The bathroom was generously sized and spotless. The windows had shutters which provided a very quiet sleep even with our street-side room. Our trip was in celebration of my 30th birthday, and my father asked the hotel to arrange for a cake to be delivered (it was a Sunday and a national holiday). They not only brought a beautiful (and delicious) fruit torte, but presented it to us compliments of the hotel. The manager, Daniele, was fabulous and all the staff continued to remember us and wish me a happy birthday throughout the trip! The breakfast room was beautiful and overlooks lemon trees in the courtyard of the neighboring convent. The food was tasty and included a nice selection of cereals, fruit, eggs, meat, and pastries. The server remembered our coffee preferences after the first day. The roof top bar was also nice, with great views of Trastevere. All in all, the Hotel San Francesco was a wonderful experience and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a gem - closer than you might think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This one is truly a keeper. My wife and I stayed here for three nights in early May '05. The room was not huge, but the bathroom was of a good size. In the morning, with the convent bells gently ringing and the sun shining through the open bathroom window, showers were a great way to start the day. The breakfasts were complete - more than enough to last through to lunch. The staff was friendly and helpful - I even enjoyed speaking some German with Sabine. Our standard travel method was to hop the tram - the nearest stop is 100 paces from the hotel door (on Via Girolamo Induno) - to get to Piramide and then to take the Metropolitana anywhere we needed to go. Believe me, it's a pleasure to end a day in Rome by coming back to a hotel like this one - a refuge from the mania of downtown. I know we'll come back to Rome, and when we do, we know where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful area”
Reviews.Author: XMurphy
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel in a wonderful area of Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was small by American standards, but more than adequate. It was nicely decorated and had a safe, tv, fridge, and large closet (and chocolates on the desk!). The bathroom was huge and very modern. The rooftop bar was a nice place for a drink and the breakfast buffet had a large selection. This hotel is located in Travestere, a wonderful section of Rome. There were many restaurants and bars and the area had a great atmosphere. It was also an easy location to get to all the sites. Also, there is a train station in this area of town that will take you directly to the airport for 5 euro (much easier than going to Termini and then taking a taxi -- cheaper, as well). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Trastevere is said to be a bit 'off' Rome. But transportation is close to the hotel, and the area is great for dining. The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are not too big, but for a couple of days it's allright, and the shower is excellent, as is the breakfast. The roof bar gives a nice view over Rome, and even a peek to St. Peter's. The cab driver scared us a bit because he thought the whole building was a convent, but...yes, there is an entrance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel San Francesco our first married week (the first week of March 2005) and were delighted with the hotel, the staff, and the location. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a genuine smile and made to feel welcome. The day staff speaks more english than the night staff but everyone was very friendly and accomodating. Our room was clean, comfortable and had a HUGE bathroom (a generous size even by American standards) with a tub that my wife loved. I don't think all rooms have the tub. Breakfast was lavish and tasty: breads, eggs, bacon, meats, cheese, cereal, milk, coffee and juice - a welcome way to start a long day of walking and sightseeing. It was too chilly at night to use the rooftop bar, but we peeked up for a look and the view looked beautiful. Even so, there is a small bar in the lobby that was perfect for a glass of wine before going out to dinner. The hotel has a computer just off the lobby for guest use as well. Hotel San Francesco is tucked away on a quiet street in Trastevere, but we found it very easy to get anywhere in Rome. A block and a half away, the #8 tram will take you north across the Tiber River and just blocks from the Pantheon, and the #3 tram stops half a block from the hotel and will take you to the Colosseum. We bought a bus/tram/train map of Rome (6 euros) as well as a week-long public transportation pass (16 euros each) and found that we were able to zip around Rome with little problem when we were too tired to walk any further. When the day came to leave, we felt as though we were saying goodbye to a home and to family. If our travels bring us back to Rome in the future, there will be no question about where to stay. Hotel San Francesco truly helped make our honeymoon in Rome unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “when can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: Leeds40ish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Francesco for four nights at the end of March and I can truly say that it was one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had in Italy. The service at the hotel was excellent, the staff were accomodating and friendly. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome- go on book it! But make sure to throw a coin in the Trevi fountain before you leave- then you're sure to come back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We left our heart in San Francesco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francesco in Trastevere, Rome was a true delight. The location was perfect, the breakfasts plentiful and delicious, the staff was kind and helpful and the rooms were spotless. Trastevere is a very lively and picturesque part of Rome and this hotel was in the perfect location. It was also very affordable. We cannot wait to go back to Hotel San Francesco.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if you want to stay in Trastevere.”
Reviews.Author: kesh
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel San Francesco for two nights in March. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable, although the bathroom was a little shabby. The choice at breakfast is great - especially if you like cake! Only minutes to the tram stop to take you to the Colosseum, and a pleasant 5 minute stroll into the heart of Trastevere. The Vatican is around a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Good value, as we paid around 150 Euro for the room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Discover the real Rome from this hotel - another great discovery!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Friendly, empathetic service is the first thing to mark out this hotel as a desirable destination. As below, a really good hint is to telephone the hotel and ask them to book you a car from the airport: they are most obliging and we paid half (45 euros) what some fellow guests had. The place itself is next: a classy outside with an interior that blends “boutique” – if you must – with just good Italian taste (e.g. decent balance between modern, slightly gaudy elegance and tradition; all on the human, rather than the grand, scale). The breakfast room is indeed lovely, chic appointments commanding a picturesque (romantic, run-down) cloister; plus a truly, unexpectedly generous and delicious breakfast buffet, certainly the best we’ve enjoyed in Italy (and with splendid young Luciano in attendance). They deserve more stars, yes: but perhaps we should keep the secret to ourselves a bit longer. Finally – and what a finale – the location. Trastevere transcends all (and recent) publicity; rumours of incipient “loss of character” are thankfully just rubbish. The character, atmosphere and almost casual, everyday beauty of the locale will absolutely take your breath away. The essence of Rome is in these streets; the piazza of Santa Maria seems to have the whole range of the dolce vita out for a stroll. With the dog. Yes: the fountain is where “Damon Bradley” (Peter Wright/Robert Downey) put the shoe back on Faith’s foot! And, on Sunday afternoon, or most evenings (especially Saturday), there will be music (as if the people weren’t entertainment enough) as you make a passegiato, stop for the best gelato outside Sicily, maybe have a spremuta in the café Aranche then go for food. You don’t need a recommendation; just go where the Italians go (although we really have to mention Carlo Menta, the generous head waiter, their house special penne – a huge portion on a pizza plate for Sarah, because she said she loved her forkful so much when I ordered it before - and Sunday lunch grabbed on the way to the airport, with an exit that felt like we were leaving the family behind). From the hotel, it’s also a short stroll into the divine Sunday morning madness of the Porta Portese market. You can stroll up the Janiculum (Gianicolo) for heart-stopping views on your way to Saint Peter’s. You can grab a tram from Viale Trastevere into Argentina; get a taxi into the centre from around 7 or 8 euros. Or, best of all, walk across the Tiber and into Rome, currently at the best we’ve ever known her for the welcome of the people and the breathtaking loveliness of practically every last bit of the space she inhabits. From hotel San Francesco, you can cross, for instance, the Ponte Palatino and cut down to the Bocca della Verita for a quick impersonation of Greg and Audrey (the inevitable hands-up-sleeve photos) before climbing the Capitol and on into the Eternal herself. We hope you go to Camp de’ Fiori early in the morning, too, when the flower-stallholders are dipping bunches into sunlit fountains. Buon Viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilVerdon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good for all the restaurants and bars in the Trastevere area but also easy to get across the river for the main attractions. Also good walks up Janiculum hill with great views over Rome. If you keep going you will end up at St Peters (30-45 mins) and it beats the noise and hustle and bustle of going via the river. Good breakfast (good choice of cheese/meats/pastries/cakes etc.) in a lovely set-up over looking a 15th century cloister. Did not get a chance to use the roof terrace (very cold-early March) but did sneak a look and the views etc make for a charming place for a quiet drink in the Spring/Summer. Room was comfortable (basic), with a good sized bathroom. Hotel was very clean and tidy, staff helpful, spoke good English and very friendly. I would not hesitate to use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel San Francesco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On behalf of my family, I want to thank hotel staff for making our stay in Rome so enjoyable. The Hotel San Francesco was a big highlight of the trip. Their help in planning our trip was much appreciated. We appreciated the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. Brunch was far beyond our expectations. We will recommend the Hotel San Francesco to our friends and acquaintances. Location in Trastevere was perfect. Besides the sights in central Rome (I think we saw them all)l, we loved touring your village. The San Francesco de Ripa church is just filled with marvelous art, as is the Santa Maria Church. And we ate all of our meals in Trastevere. Food and service were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mairidh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only for one night as our first choice of hotel was full. What a lovely place it is! The booking system is the only 'con' I can think to criticise. We booked directly with the hotel. I sent several emails, some were returned (?) and some had a response. Having had experience of Rome hotels previously I decided to telephone before we left Scotland and found nothing had been reserved for us but they had a room so all was well. Having requested (several times) for a room on the first floor as I don't use lifts, I was disappointed to discover our room was on the 4th floor but this was changed on request. Having considered the problems with the booking I think perhaps there is nobody in the hotel who speaks English well enough to understand emails and telephone conversations. (I was told it was only one young lady who dealt with emails). The area was quiet and the hotel spotlessly clean. Staff were helpful and the hotel such a surprise compared with others in the city. Breakfast was far too good! Shame the roof garden was closed but we shall return. Thank you Hotel San Francesco for making our last night in Rome a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location once you've found it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once we found the hotel (get a cab from termini station - well worth 13 euros! as the buses can be confusing) it was above average. The hotel is very well positioned, trastevere is beautiful and lively and it only takes 20 minutes to walk to colessium and not much further to St Peters. Make sure you Walk up the Giancolo - breathtaking views of Rome on a clear day. The staff at Hotel San Francesco are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: shanghailil
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned January 2005 (4 nights) from Rome and a wonderful stay at the Hotel San Francesco. The hotel staff are both friendly and helpful and nothing was a problem. We easily found our way around the city and the Trastevere area, the electric bus outside the hotel door was a just great for our evenings up to the bars, Restaurants and small coffee shops along the small cobble lanes. It was cold, some sunshine but ,We just wrapped up and visited the sights either walking ,tram, bus. Breakfast fantastic with a lovely setting overlooking the cloister,bedroom was just perfect with a large bathroom and very quiet. highly recommened. Anne and Brian Routledge Newcastle UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, three friends, stayed in Hotel San Francesco in Trastevere, Rome, Italy and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is in a great location with lots of nice restaurants and bars closeby. The rooms were a good size and the bathroom was clean and big enough for the three of us. Breakfast was good - don't expect a big fry but there was plenty of fruit, cereals, cakes and bread. When we arrived we had a lovely glass of wine in the bar. We unfortunately did not get a chance to visit the roof bar but we'll definitely be back for that! If you are looking for a nice hotel in a good location then check out this one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Veranda”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a delicious stay at the Hotel San Francesco. The room was warm, confortable with a large bathroom and all the specials attentions for us (sweets, fruit...) The hotel is quiet and the staff friendly and helpfull to provide plans and how to visit Roma. As we came in january the rate of the room was very attractive and in spite of this the service still perfect. A special mention for the breakfast in this lovely veranda. "

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel San Francesco. The hotel has a great location in Trestevere- we could walk to dinner at a different restaurant every night. We loved enjoying a glass of wine on the roof terrace, watching the sunset...even in January it was warm enough to be up there. People at the front desk were wonderful about getting taxis, making dinner reservations, etc. The hotel was quiet, always had a good nights sleep..The rooms are small, but bathrooms are very nice. The breakfast is very nice, although I found it repetitive..would like more variety from one day to the next. It is a small hotel that really felt like "home" while we were in Rome. thanks for everything! Will definitely recommend Hotel San Francesco to friends and return again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Lance&Archana
Reviews.Content: Another hotel which was booked recommended this hotel to us, and I am so grateful. I can't say enough about how kind and hospitable the hotel staff was. The decor was lovely- a mix of modern and traditional. The rooms were simple but sparkling clean and comfortable. The bathroom was quite large. My husband's favorite part was that the hotel provided a limitless supply of yummy chocolates! The location in Trastevere was unbeatable- at least for what we wanted to do which was to explore Trastevere, Testaccio and the Jewish Ghetto. We were quite near the Tiber so we could easily cross over. We were also near the Porta Portese flea market and the Aventine hill. Transportation was very convenient- we took trams and buses which stopped right around the corner from the hotel. As far as the hotel, did I say how nice the hotel staff was to us? They recommended excellent restaurants, warned us about the train strike, called taxis for us and responded quickly and efficiently to all our questions and concerns. A prime example is that I left my wedding ring in the hotel room. When I called the hotel they looked for it immediately, found it and assured me that it was secure and that they would send it back to me right away. One last note is that breakfast (not included) is excellent and abundant- kept us going to late afternoon- and overlooks the absolutely gorgeous garden. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and look forward to returning to it soon.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel SF for 4 nights over New Years. It was a wonderful experience from the moment we stepped in the door. The Trastevere is a great area, great restaurants and plenty of very quaint, cute streets to explore. We loved the walk to all the sights (max 40). The Hotel itself was fantastic. The spread in the morning was delicious, lots of variety (cereals, cakes, pannetone, fresh fruits, eggs, bacon, juices...) and very beautifully laid out. The room was very clean, great bathroom. On the night of Dec. 31, the hotel was more full and we did notice we could hear our neighbour's TV. We will always remember watching the 360 degree fireworks from the terrace to ring in the New Year! Oh yes, the free internet in the lobby is an incredible plus!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “San Francesco is a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've recently got back from a short break at the san francesco and thought it was excellent. it's in my favouite part of Rome and there are loads of great bars and restaurants nearby. The staff were welcoming from the start and were very helpful throughout our stay. They created a very friendly and relaxed atmosphere that's too often lacking in modern hotels. The decor of the reception and breakfast area is quirky and individual but extremely stylish. The rooms have a more pared down decor but are still very comfortable and the bathrooms are great. I really enjoyed the breakfasts, served in a covered cloister overlooking the garden. There was a lot more choice than at many Italian hotels and much of it seemed to be home made. There is a terrace and bar situated on top of the building but unfortunately it wasn't open when we stayed (I suppose al fresco drinking isn't very popular in January!). Hotel San Francesco has really good rates in low season so it's extremely good value. I can't wait to book my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Francisco a Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and enjoyed our stay at the Hotel San Francisco very much. They have a very nice breakfast room with a wounderful garden view. They also have a wonderful roof top terrace with a bar, Very enjoyable. The staff is very friendly and helpful with any questions you might have. A full service hotel in a GREAT AREA. We just love being in the Trastevere Area. It's more like a small town in the big city. I would return to the Hotel San Francisco on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: lizzy217
Reviews.Content: This hidden jewel was amazing. I feel like I should not be disclosing such a great treasure, but I must! We stayed 5 nights in late December. The entire staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable even before arriving via e-mail. Massimo recommended the best ways to get around town and things to do. Our room was medium sized for european standards and the bathrooms are huge and comfortable, it was imaculately cleaned everyday. Breakfast were very large and enjoyable, they had a huge array of pastries, drinks, fresh coffee, eggs, bacon, and breads and was suitable for vegetarians. It is 15-20 minutes to the colusseum and all the other attractions. If you are looking to come home to a place away from the crowds this is the place to stay. It gets a little hectic with all us tourists! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Away from the tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Kdunn33
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank all of you for our wonderful stay in September (15-17). This hotel is the perfect place to stay, away from the crowds, the noise, and the busy tourist areas. We want to be sure and say a special thank you to Luciano, who served our cocktails on the rooftop bar. He was so very helpful when we asked about a restaurant -- he provided a map, and explained how to get there. He also was very attentive in making our cocktails just the way we like them! We are from Louisville, Kentucky, in the USA. We are accustomed to lots of ice in a cocktail........ and Luciano was the perfect gentleman when my husband requested the extra ice. He made our stay extra special. Thank you all so very much for a wonderful, restful, and elegant stay in Rome. We will be back, and we will be sure to stay with you again. Grazie, Karen Louisville, Kentucky

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Should have written this ages ago, though in fact reading other reviewers' comments who have stayed here more recently, they clearly enthuse about it as much as I do. Our family of five stayed here over Christmas 2003. Great location, clean, good value, helpful staff. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel & district of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband & young son from the 15th - 22nd of October 2004 and it was very enjoyable. The hotel itself was tastefully decorated, very clean, the breakfast was excellent and we absolutely loved the rooftop terrace(although the picture on the website & literature needs updating as the existing picture appears very old & does not do it justice at all.) It was also in an excellent location in Trastevere with the main street - Viale di Trastevere - and many shops & restaurants closeby. The staff were extremely friendly & efficient.....my family especially developed a great affinity with young Luciano who worked in the rooftop bar. We hope to visit again sometime in the future and will definitely come back to Hotel Francesco. I have also recommended the hotel to all my family & friends. Try the following resturants "La Piazzeta" in Via Francesco a Ripa which is just along the street from the Pizza Cafe "Frontini"(freshly made pizzas are great here both Pizza Rosso & Bianca) on the corner of main street. Food, especially pizza & steaks are very good, cooked in an open fired oven. Staff were also very nice to my seven year old son. Also, try my favourite, "Da Albino il sardo all'angoletto" in Via della Luce 44-45. It doesn't look anything from the outside but again, the food & staff were brilliant. Try the Sardinian dessert "Sardea" which is puff pastry filled with cheese and drizzled with bitter honey - absolutely immense. Pizza & meat dishes were delicious & perfectly cooked. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in trastevere”
Reviews.Author: marcellomac
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - central location in Trastevere (where there is not much to chose from) which is a fun and exciting area, with scores of restaurants. Adjacent to bus and tram lines to get anywhere in Rome quickly, and easily accessable from the airport by train to Trastevere termini and then the tram. The staff that went above and beyond in helping us, and were ex exceptional; this hotel had the best buffet breakfast of the hotels we stayed at in Rome in a 16 day trip. Rooftop terrace is an outstanding place to unwind with a drink at the end of the day with fabulous views. Good size, very quiet rooms and great bathroom. My only complaint is that the sign on the front of the hotel could be a bit larger! Will be going back next month for another stay, and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reviews here, I expected much more from this hotel. We just returned from an October 2004 trip and would not recommend the San Francesco. There was only enough hot water for one person to take a shower each morning of our stay (4 nights), the room was small, the bed was rock hard with uncomfortable foam pillows, and the rooftop bar had virtually no view and was furnished with a tacky modern decor. The location is not in a pretty part of Trastevere and the 15 minute walk into central Rome can add additional stress to your stay that is unnecessary. The hotel did have free internet access in the lobby, which was a nice benefit.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: DanHBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2004 and our ONLY complaint was the noise - both from the neighboring rooms and the construction next door. The walls are thin so you hear it when your next door neighbor wakes up and when the construction starts - both of which tended to be 7am each day. Other than that this hotel is a gem - nice rooms, excellent breakfast buffet, relaxing roof bar, good location on public transportation lines, in Trastevere, etc. The front desk personnel spoke English and Spanish and were very friendly and helpful (having arrived from Paris, this was a very pleasant change). The rooms were nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable, there was a decent size closet, and the bathroom was very nice. This hotel was recommended by another hotel that was full and we paid 210 Euro/night. A little expensive for us (the exchange rate was $1.30 at the time) but relative to the other choices, this was a good value. For those willing to pay more, you could do better. For those of you like us that can't go any higher than 210 Euro/night, this is a good choice. We would rate this higher if the rooms had better sound insulation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Francesco
HotelInfo.Address: Via Jacopa de_ Settesoli, 7, 00153 Rome, Italy
